name: היחידה בקטמון
amenities: Essentials - Towels, bed sheets, soap, and toilet paper
Dedicated workspace - A desk or table with a chair and space for a laptop.
description: יחידת חדר  בעיצוב עדין, נעים ומרווח.   היחידה כוללת מטבחון (עם פלטה ומיחם לשומרי שבת)שירותים ומקלחת,פינת עבודה עם חיבור לאינטרנט.החניה ברחוב ללא תשלוםThe spaceהמקום מיועד למי שמבקש חויה שקטה ונעימה בשכונה ירושלמית בלב שכונת קטמון שבהשראתה נוצרה סידרת הטלויזיה  'סרוגים'.בחזית הבית גינה שטופת שמש, עצים וירק בה אורחינו יכולים להתרווח.היחידה מעוצבת בטוב טעם והרמוניה, בסיגנון ים תיכוני- אתני.Other things to noteאין לעשן בשום אופן בתוך היחידה
additional_house_rules: בסף שבוע הפינוי במוצאי שבת/ ראשון
interaction: אני לרוב זמינה בנייד.
transit: קרוב למקומות בילוי נעימים כמו מתחם התחנה והמושבה הגרמנית,בית הנסן, מוזיאון הטבע, תאטרון ירושלים, פארק סן סימון, ובמרחק נסיעה קצרה מגן סאקר והמוזיאונים, מהעיר העתיקה וממרכז העיר.

reviews.comments: The room is large, well furnished, easy to access, and quiet. Parking on the street is a problem, but that's a problem all over Jerusalem. Naama set us up with a large hot water kettle and a hotplate, as well as three timers--useful for us Orthodox Jews. We were most pleased with our weekend stay.
Great apartment all round. Highly recommend it.
well kept beautiful quiet quaint little studio apartment
Nice , Clean , Great Host  and excellent location for our purpose.
Neama's place is so homey and comfortable! this was our second time staying there and it did not disappoint. ne'ama pays attention to every detail and is very responsive. Will definitely come again!

We had a great time staying at Naama's place. It was exactly what we needed for a fun weekend in Jerusalem. Naama was nice throughout our stay, and made sure we have all we need. Will definitely come again.
מקום נעים, מושקע ומטופח. מיקום מעולה - שקט ונגיש.
חמוד נעים ונקי
היחידה חמודה ונעימה, והאירוח של נעמה היה מקסים ומתחשב!

reviews.comments:

מרכזי

description: A great location in East Jerusalem's city centre that you will love! Comfortable and practical. Explore the Old City of Jerusalem while you stay with us. Only a 10 m walk to Damascus Gate & Old City. Only 1.5 Km to the Church of the Holy Sepulchre and about 1.6 Km to the Dome of the Rock and Al Aqsa Mosque.Taxi service next door. Mineral water, coffee, a variety of teas and fresh juice on the house, always!The spaceNice spacious two bedrooms. 1 full bathroom. Spacious living room and kitchen area with a terrace. Lively location. Kitchen has all that you need.  Generous dining area. Workspace. Enjoy on the house a wide selection of teas, fresh fruits, Espresso and Arabic coffees and mineral water. Work space. Guidebooks and magazines.Guest accessEntire apartment.Other things to notePlease conserve electricty and water use.
additional_house_rules: No smoking please except in balcony. Please conserve electricity use and keep apartment clean. No loud music. No extra guests. No pets please.
interaction: Happy to advise guests.
transit: Just a few minutes to the bus line and tram. Taxi service next door. Parking is just a couple of minutes away.

reviews.comments:
Nice and confortable apartment very close to the old city . Excellent wifi and
AC. Taxi, Market and a good take out food arround the corner. Ibrahim is an Excellent Host

We had a nice stay at Ibrahim and Sawsan's place. Ibrahim was great with communication throughout. He was very accommodating with our check in time as we didn't know how long it would take for us to cross the border from Jordan. The apartment itself is basic, clean, and was more than enough space for our group of four. It's located outside the old city, about a 25 minute walk from Masjid ul-Aqsa. Shops in the area close early, so be sure to stock up on drinking water and snacks earlier in the day.
Good location,attentive host, would stay there again.

Amazing location in East Jerusalem. This large two bedroom apartment was more than big enough to fit our family of five and could easily accommodate 6. Ibrahim was a great host, very responsive. The apartment was well set up for a family. We didn’t spend much time in the apartment admittedly but we made food two nights - simple meals. There is a supermarket and pharmacy round the corner and a public parking place five minutes walk away. The area is great, ten minutes to the old city, in the heart of east Jerusalem. Very safe and serene area. Happy walking here even at night. Vibrant local life. If you want to experience real life in this amazing city this area is a wonderful blend of ancient and modern - not shi shi modern or gentrified modern, but real life modern. Can’t recommend enough and urge everyone to support businesses in the east of the city!

Great location next to easy shopping to buy meal supplies, public transportation and old city.  Neighborhood very friendly and a great that we could park our rental car very inexpensively.  Sunny and Spacious and comfortable apt., Really appreciated the nice touches of coffee and oranges, and other snacks and towels and toiletries to help us feel at home.  Ibrahim and his wife are very caring and tentative hosts.  Highly recommend.
Ibrahim is a fantastic host who was very willing to accommodate me with an early checkin and early check out.

Had a very nice one week+ stay at Ibrahim's. Perfect location in E. Jerusalem (right next to my new office and easy walking distance to shops, restaurants, and old city). Comfortable flat with all the necessary. Ibrahim was very easy to communicate with and was kind enough to have a cold drink in the fridge, tea and coffee, as well as some basic food provisions. Very much recommended. Thanks much Ibrahim!

Ibrahim’s apartment was large,  comfy and clean and he was on hand and a friendly host.  The location is in the center of the American Colony in East Jerusalem,  an easy walk to light rail,  hotels,  and small groceries.   There are cafes (open on Shabbats) on each end of the block.  Recommend.
Ibrahim and his wife are fantastic hosts.  Apartment is large, with separate bedrooms and very close to the Old City.  They were very helpful with restaurants and places to see..  Would stay again!
Ibrahim is a wonderful and attentive host and the apartment is extremely well located, spacious, and clean. I will definitely return!

Brilliant stay at Ibrahim and sawsans apartment. It was great location, clean, spacious and a small balcony with a view. I was planning to extend my stay but plans took another direction.

Ibrahim was kind, communicative and prepared everything to ensure we felt home. I came with a friend but next time will return with my family. Thank you ibrahim.

the house had a very sharp bad smell like pee on the sofa when I entered, there was dust everywhere, dirt, not cleaned properly. i was going to stay 11 nights, but i shortened to 2 nights and left. Ibrahim was in this period too busy to deal with the house i think. he was very polite and offered to bring a cleaner again next morning and an air refresher. the house is not only very old furnished, but it also smells. if u r coming with 5 people, maybe it is worth it the price if cleaned properly, but it is not worth it for solo travelers.

Ibrahim was a gracious and knowledgeable host, knows the area well. The location is superb, 10-minute walk from Damascus Gate and around the corner from the American Colony hotel - great for afternoon drinks. The apartment is comfortable and close to a lot of food shops. The small terrace is a plus. I couldn't figure out the TV, but Ibrahim can help on the tech front. Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.response:
Thanks, Eric. I hope to see you again soon.
Best
Ibrahim

reviews.comments: Ibrahim was a very nice host and the apartment has a great location close to everything.

Ibrahim is a wonderful host, great communication, very prompt response and a pleasure to deal with.

The apartment is situated in a lovely friendly community with a taxi rank and restaurant right next door. It is very near the old town, less than a minute stroll to Damascus gate and Herod’s gate.

The apartment is well laid out, spacious, comfortable and had everything we needed.

I can highly recommend to future visitors to Jerusalem.

Many thanks Ibrahim.
Sawsan and Ibrahim are very gentle hosts

We had a very good stay in the apartment.
Hibrahim is an exceptional host. Available and very kind during our stay.
I recommend it without hesitation.
Great place, very good location!

Ibrahim's place is great  place to stay.   Everything was straightforward and Ibrahim replied quickly to queries and was there to meet us.    There was some delicious fruit awaiting us in the kitchen.  There is a sunny area outside where we sat enjoying the morning sunshine.
Ibrahim's place is very well located with spacious accommodation. Ibrahim was very responsive to any requests and was very easy to communicate with.
Thanks for having us :) Great location and cool and easy host.

This place is wonderfully located only 5 minutes walk from Damascus gate even my elderly mom( 86!) could walk it.
The apartment is on the first floor, clean and very spacious with a little terrasse.
Ibrahim is a great host, very reactive and we found fresh fruit and chocolates on the table. I can highly recommend if you want to have a feel of local East Jerusalem life!

Ibrahim's place is very centrally located: The old town can be reached in a short walk on foot, the taxi stand around the corner is also very convenient for longer journeys. The apartment is very spacious and also has a terrace to sit and eat out if the weather permits. Ibrahim is very responsive to all your needs.
reviews.response:
Thanks for pointing out this, Otto. I will take care of it. Hope to see you again soon.
Best,
Ibrahim

reviews.comments: Very close to old city, as expected for an older building.  There is a busy street adjacent so a bit noisy, but again as expected for location.  Ibrahim is a great host and very helpful.  The apartment was clean and has all you need.
reviews.response: Very happy that your first experience with Airbnb was good. Hope to see you back again.

reviews.comments: The place is even nicer than the pictures suggest, spacious and comfortable and airy and it's nice to use the balcony. It's nice to have a washing machine and separate heating in each room. Ibrahim was always there immediately if we needed anything and messaged us regularly to see if we needed anything. Plastic bottles can be recycled opposite the petrol station. This is a friendly, safe neighbourhood even for a woman walking around at night. I highly recommend it!
Very clean and comfortable. Great location and friendly welcome from Ibrahim. Thanks again for the stay!

Great location. Can walk everywhere in Jerusalem from here, especially the Old City. Spacious sitting area and comfortable bedrooms and bathrooms. The apartment is a little bit dark.  Ibrahim is a great host and check on us a couple of times during our stay to make sure everything was in order.  Highly recommended.

We staid over two weeks with our two small children in Ibrahim's place. It is a very comfortable apartment with all amenities. Good location for East Jerusalem and the old town, a few grocery shops close by and at the next corner is a very good restaurant. Ibrahim is a very friendly host and always available when we needed help.
reviews.response: Gerold arrived to Jerusalem to live and work. He stayed at my apartment while he was looking for something permanent. I enjoyed hosting him and his family and was very pleased when they extended their stay.  Will surely host them again as they were kind and considerate.

reviews.comments:
We spend five nights at Ibrahim's, and we had a great time. We were five people, and at first there were beds for only four people, so Ibrahim went right away to get a new matress for our accomodations. We had a constant comunication, we were always in touch through the airbnb app and (Hidden by Airbnb) . He is a very thoughtfull host, wether recomending local restaurants or helping us getting taxis, he was always kin to give us the best adrice.
The location is very good, very close to the old city, a ten minutes walk to Herod's gate and 15 to Damascus. However the street can get a little bit trafic-noisy during the nights, pack your earplugs.
Overall a good place and a thoughtfull host. We enjoyed our time in Jerusalem.
reviews.response: The Caballero family stayed for 5 nights at my apartment here in Jerusalem. I was very happy to meet and converse with them. They were lovely and kind enough to leave a little souvenir from Mexico. Would definitely recommend them. I hope their travels are going well!

reviews.comments: Ibrahim was at his flat to welcome us and to let us have the keys.  He showed us briefly around, gave us his contact details, and promised to return with an extra key for the outer door to the street for my colleague as we wanted to have two complete sets in case we got split up.  He did not return with this extra key.
reviews.response: Sorry Jonathan, but you mentioned that you and your colleague were always moving together so I didn't think an extra copy of the outside gate would be absolutely crucial. I have emailed Jonathan during his stay to see if he needed anything but he didn't answer. I sat with you for over half an hour to welcome you and i gave you a lot of information on where to go, how to find taxis and bus stations, and how to get to Bethlehem and to Dheishe refugee camp and how to get to Ramallah and which bus and shuttle service to get to Nablus, i even drew maps for you.

reviews.comments: Great place! We really enjoyed staying at Ibrahim's lovely apartment, and it's a short walk from the old city. Ibrahim was also a great host--we were delayed coming into Jerusalem, but he was very flexible with our key pickup time. We'd definitely stay there again!

Appartement très bien situé, proche de la vieille ville et du centre, commerces et transports pour visiter Jerusalem à proximité.  Bonne literie (important pour moi car j'ai des problèmes de dos),  spacieux et propre.  Il faudrait juste penser à ajouter un micro-ondes, 1 placard en plus dans la cuisine (manque de rangement pour courses),  1 petite télé pour les enfants, et nécessité d'améliorer la terrasse ( 1 store pour le soleil) et 1 store neuf pour les chambres. Sinon c'était bien.   Brigitte et Essam  (séjour fin juillet 2019)

Ibrahim a toujours était disponible à chaques fois que nous avions une question.

L'appartement est bien équipé, avec plein de petites attentions. On s'y sent chez nous !

L'emplacement est parfait à 10min de la porte d'Herod, et 15min de la porte de damas (environ). Donc vielle ville faisable à pied (nous l'avons fait avec un bébé en poussette)
Tout ça en étant tout de même dans une rue calme, proche de tout commerces : épicerie, restaurant, parking à 2 pas de l'appartement à un prix imbattables sur Jérusalem (25 shekel/24h), transport en commun (arrêt "ministère de la justice").
Appartement clair, ensoleillé et bien équipé, tout proche de la Vieille Ville et d’un quartier commerçant. Idéal pour un séjour familial, avec un « super -host très disponible et accueillant

Ibrahim fue una gran persona con nosotras. Nuestro vuelo llegó a la madrugada y él nos esperó a que llegaramos (5 am) Fue atento cada vez que le enviamos un mensaje y nos ayudó con información del lugar, y para cambiar dinero. Realmente es fue un placer y una tranquilidad rentar su departamento. Además, el sitio esta muy cerca de la ciudad vieja y en una zona tranquila pero con acceso al transporte público. Gracias nuevamente

description: 3.5 Room Apt. in German Colony ,Jerusalem2 Bed-rooms 1 livin-groom 1 kid Room,1 toilet ,1 bathroom, 1 office room (under constraction),  (a large Kitchen and 300 sq yard) Beautiful view over German colony 1 minute on foot From "first station" Jerusalem and bus station to all over Jerusalem areas close to city center and old city 15 min on foot ',.Enjoy the ideal location in JerusalemThe spacegorgeous 3.5 + 1 office Room, in a Templar German House. it has a special authentic design - thick walls,  brick inner wall,  a great atmosphere. it is also located in the most charming, fun and historical neighborhood in Jerusalem.Guest accessThe apartment comes fully furnished with fast wireless internet, full-kitchen,washing machine, Clothes Dryer ,Refrigerator, freezer ,towels linens ,extra blankets ,It has a 2 double bed In every bedroom, Cabinets for shelving, And a Large Garden with Seating Areas,office for workplace ( office under constraction) . There is free parking 50 meter from the apartment... and many more other things for the staying ...Other things to note-Free wifi .-Free coffe, tea and cold water ( Coffee corner) . -Free guest pc using .-TV with ps4 ( lot of games) ,netflix, in room 1 .-TV with chrome tv in room 2 .

transit: there is lot of transportation (all the time of the day until 23:59 PM ,Buses every 5 Min)its a very central neighborhood close to anywhere in Jerusalem (The heart of Jerusalem)there is free parking lot 30 seconds on foot from the house

reviews.comments: The location is excellent and the apartment has a great yard. There a few small things that need to be fixed in the apartment such as no WiFi and no AC, but everything was really comfortable . Again, the location outweighs everything else!
Dor’s house and garden fits very well for children, we enjoyed the neighborhood- and the house is very well located. Beautiful garden and space

Great location
clean and cool place

Exellent location, near to everything. Very nice garden. Dor is a great host.
Thanks!!

We had a great weekend stay in this real Templar stone house in the middle of the German colony. Dor is an extremely kind host and it was very nice to interact with him at check in and check out. The garden has a huge space and is protected by big trees. We had our lunch, dinner and breakfast outside (October). The location is very central - short walking distance from the first station district. The is also a free parking space in a short walking distance, otherwise main bus lines are nearby.
אזור  מדהים  ביופיו

name: Jerusalem SweetSuite: Near Ramat Rachel/US Embassy
amenities: Essentials - Towels, bed sheets, soap, and toilet paper
Dedicated workspace - A desk or table with a chair and space for a laptop.
Kitchen - Space where guests can cook their own meals
Cooking basics - Pots and pans, oil, salt and pepper
Dishes and silverware - Bowls, chopsticks, plates, cups, etc.
Private entrance - Separate street or building entrance
Backyard - An open space on the property usually covered in grass
Single level home - No stairs in home
Luggage dropoff allowed - For guests' convenience when they have early arrival or late departure
Long term stays allowed - Allow stay for 28 days or more
description: A fantastic one-bedroom ground floor getaway suite is your Jerusalem home away from home. Located in the upscale Arnona neighborhood a few blocks from the new US Embassy, a 10 minute walk to Ramat Rachel Hotel, and 3 minutes to Lindenbaum College.  Everything is included here for a comfortable stay.  Whether touring the city, visiting family, celebrating Shabbat, or for a business trip, you will enjoy your stay.  It's a great place and can accommodate 3 people and a baby, or 2 adults and 2 kids.The space* The entrance to the apartment suite is through an indoor entrance hall / common area.* The bedroom is very comfortable and has tons of closet space and a dresser.  A portable crib can be set up there as well and a high chair and baby toys are available too.* The living room is equipped with a comfortable sofa with a pull-out bed that can sleep 2.* There is a Smart TV with Israeli Cable (HOT) which includes international news channels.  Guests are welcome to use our Netflix account so they will feel right at home and can binge watch after a long day of touring.* There is a dedicated Wi-Fi router in the apartment with its own Ethernet cable jack for hi-speed internet access.  If you are traveling for business we can provide access to a printer as well.* The kitchenette is simple yet functional.  There is a refrigerator, microwave, toaster oven, and electric burners.   The kitchen is kosher and for dairy use and includes a basic frying pan, pot, pasta strainer, dishes, and silverware.  (If you are not Kosher we have separate dishes and pots for non-Kosher users.)  An electric hot water kettle for coffee and tea is included.  For Sabbath observers there is a hot water urn and hot plate.* The bathroom is large and has a shower and vanity.  There is a washing machine and a drying rack too.  An iron and small ironing board are also included.  * The apartment is generally cool and there is a portable air conditioner that can be used when needed.  * There is an outdoor sitting area which is common space.  You are welcome to use the outdoor basketball hoop to play or practice your jump shot.  One of our kids is always up for a game if you are looking for some competition.
additional_house_rules:
Please enquire about early check-in or late check out.  During high season we will be required to charge a fee for this accommodation.
Early check in, more than an hour early and up to 10 hours early,  if the apartment is available - 50% of a nights rate.
Late check out, more than an hour late and up to 5 hours late,  if the apartment is available - 50% of a nights rate.
interaction: Our family lives upstairs so there may be some friendly interaction.  We are more than happy to answer questions or make suggestions.
transit: Getting around town is easy.  There is plenty of free parking right outside the apartment and there is easy access driving to Derech Hevron, a main road, as well as the Begin Highway.  For those who like to walk, the Tayelet, Jerusalem Promenade overlooking the entire city is a scenic walk where you can see Herodian, the Judean Desert, and the Dead Sea on a clear day.

reviews.comments: The place was very clean and Tami and Mitchell were very helpful and communicative. Thanks!

Our stay at Tami and Mitchell’s Airbnb was wonderful! They are fantastic, friendly and most accommodating hosts. Their rental is clean and extremely comfortable. Added benefits include the abundant fun toys that our Israeli grandchildren loved playing with. Tami and Mitchell let us use a hotplate and hot water urn for shabbat. We enjoyed talking with them and some of their beautiful children.

The rental is located on a very quiet street in Arnona, a lovely community in southern Jerusalem near the US Embassy. We plan to use their rental whenever we visit Jerusalem.

Our stay at Tami and Mitchel's air bnb was a great experience. We were forced to vacate our own apartment and the same day arrangements were made for us to stay here. We really appreciated the quick responses made by Mitchel. He really made us feel at home during a time where we needed it the most. Our children were even given toys to play with, which they loved. The apartment was very nice and had everything needed to feel comfortable. We definitely will recommend everyone we know to stay here. Thanks again!!
Helpful hosts and a well equipped apartment
Fantastic hospitality.
a warm welcome to a well equiped apartment
Tami and Mitchell went over and above to make our stay comfortable!!

Mitchell and Tami were amazing hosts who exceeded our expectations. He waited in the cold for us at check in to ensure we found the place and provided us with detailed verbal and written  information about the place and area which was very helpful. Mitchell often checked on us and offered assistance when needed.The house was very comfortable and warm for 3 of us and we had all the essential amenities in the kitchen. A bowl of fruits, coffee  tea and biscuits/chocolates were left for us which was a very thoughtful touch. Acess to public transport was very easy from the house. Thank you for the amazing stay and all the help, we hope to see you again in the future!

(I lived 7 nights and spent USD934)
Strong points: The couple landlords are very very nice, they bought the food for me in advance and prepare the wine, beer, cake, cookies and fruit for the present! The place is very clean.
Weak points: the address no. 51 is incorrect; the place was rebuilt from a garage, barely have sound insulation, I used the ear-plugged but still heard the neighbors chatting, neighbors used the weeder and other machine, kids screamed in the street, even someone jumped in the front of my window to look after his cat or a person (manny)... the location is in very south of Jerusalem, no restaurant/store/super market/coffee shop..., only one bakery and bus no. 7 nearby!
reviews.response:
Thanks kindly for the review. We enjoyed hosting you. Glad we could help in providing your grocery list before arrival to make your stay easier and more enjoyable. AirBnB determined the address based on (Hidden by Airbnb) Maps therefore we communicated with you via the AirBnB APP well in advance of your arrival the correct address in detail, which is one house over, and even provided 2 pictures of the street and entrance to the house. Additionally, we also met you at night upon arrival from your Taxi and helped you in with your bag to assure an easy check-in. And for your departure we called the taxi company for you upon your request.

The private entrance door to the apartment is though a car port / garage which is common to the apartment you stayed in and the one upstairs. It was originally built along with the entire building from cement and cinder blocks which are standard insulation materials. In the neighborhood on Shabbat and Holidays kids play in the streets, and during the regular days people use lawn mowers and weeder machines. Most of the time the neighborhood is very quiet. The apartment is set back from the street and is not accessible except through the private garden of the property.

We appreciated that you stayed with us on the Jewish New Year which is a 2-day holiday and on a Shabbat. During those times the local shopping center, which is a 5 minute walk away is closed. There is a bakery - Lehem Shel Tomer, a pharmacy – Arnona Pharmacy, a mini-supermarket – Zol Tov, 2 hair dressers, and a nail salon. Conveniently, the apartment is a 10 minute walk to the Ramat Rachel Hotel which serves a buffet breakfast and dinner everyday which can be purchased, as well as a lobby-bar cafe, and another dairy Italian restaurant in the Ramat Rachel Spa is also available.

Regarding the location in Southern Jerusalem, that is correct. The title description of the apartment says it is located close to Ramat Rachel and the US Embassy in Jerusalem in the Arnona neighborhood. We are a little confused with your disappointment with the location of the apartment because your initial inquiry to us indicated that you wanted to stay close to the Ramat Rachel Hotel.

We were happy to read in your review that your appreciated the extra attention and assistance that we provided for you - we were happy to do it, and we would be happy to host you again.

reviews.comments:
Tami and Mitchel were great hosts. They arranged everything we needed in order to make us feel like home. I totally recommend their place for staying in Jerusalem as they are always attentive and showing support in anything you may need.
The location is great, especially if you had an event at Ramat Rachel, which is very close (8 to 10 min walk) or at the US Embassy. Besides, Jerusalem Old City is 50 min walk from their apartment. Also, the bus (N. 7) station to go to the center of Jerusalem is just a few steps away from their house.
Another detail that we enjoyed a lot was the welcome package they offered us, and so far it's been the first time we got this detail in our Airbnb experience as guests.

Bonsoir
Notre séjour s’est très bien déroulé
Tami et Mitchel étaient très réactifs et nous avons pu échanger avant et pendant le séjour
L’appartement est chaleureux et confortable
Nous étions en hiver et il est très bien isolé et chauffé
Merci beaucoup pour cet appartement
Nous le recommandons

Nous avons trouvé un homme sympathique et une famille tres accueillante, toujours à nos bons soins.cet appartement  est très beau, propre avec tout à  bord ,très idéal pour un couple,je vous le conseil  vivement, vous ne regretterai jamais d'avoir fait la connaissance de cette belle famille

Estuve 1 semana junto con mis padres en el apartamento de Tami & Mitchell,  fueron unos grandes anfitriones, tanto ellos dos como sus hijos!; el apartamento es bastante cómodo y fresco (fuimos en verano) y el barrio bonito y bastante seguro.  Siempre estuvieron atentos de nosotros y ante cualquier tipo de necesidad que tuviéramos obteníamos respuestas de ellos muy rápido. La ubicación es bastante buena!, cerca hay parada de bus, tiendas, farmacias, etc. Súper recomendado este lugar para quedarse ! Junto con mis padres volveríamos a quedarnos con ellos.

With over 250 beds, the hostel hosts guests from around the world who enjoy its warm atmosphere, convenient location, friendly staff, daily events and tours, and extensive facilities. We look forward to welcoming you to Jerusalem and extending the famous hospitality of Abraham, from Biblical times to your visit.The spacePerfect for a travelling pair who want some more privacy, our Economy 2 Bed rooms (around 17 sq m in size) have 2 single beds or a double bed (preferences can be specified in booking remarks) and en suite bathroom facilities. The room can be set with 2 separate single beds upon request.Guest accessFull access to all the facilities of Abraham Hostel JerusalemOther things to noteIsraeli citizens are obliged to pay VAT.Breakfast can be purchased at reception for 30 shekels per day.

 PCR Covid-19 test performed within 72 hours prior to arrival; or a Rapid test performed at one of the designated locations within 24 hours of arrival.

transit: The hostel is within walking distance of the Central Bus Station (15 minute walk), and the tram stops right outside.

reviews.comments: I have stayed in the Abraham Hostel for one month, and I would highly recommend the Hostel. The location is very close to... everything: right in the middle of Jerusalem, next to the light rail station. The people at the reception desk are very kind and talkative, and the WIFI is fast. Everything an international student or traveller wishes for!
Nice and cozy place in a good location. Helpful hosts and good communication.

reviews.comments: It's very nice staying here. Specially because of the location and comfort!

There was lots of noise from the bar downstairs, no sealing options.

The building was close on the weekend and we haven't noticed this information from the hostel
The stay was very nice
The owner upgraded our reservation and helped us with the check-in. She is responsive and answered to all our questions. highly recommended!
Amazing location & cute little room. Very clean

The apartment is very clean and well furnitured. The Wifi is fast and there is a TV. It is located in the city center, very close to the old town. Cheap or free parking spots were hard to find for us. There is a good air-conditioning, but there are air drafts coming from some window. We really enjoyed our stay.
A great experience
מיקום מעולה ומרכזי, קצת רועש בלילה אבל סביל
לא להסתמך על המטבחון הוא מחוץ לדירה עצמה.

המיקום של הדירה מטורף! ממש על המדרחוב של יפו, במרחק הליכה שווה פחות או יותר לכותל / ממילא / שוק מחנה יהודה. הדירה הייתה נקייה, מסודרת ומאובזרת היטב. יש מיטה זוגית, מיטת נוער, WiFi, טלוויזיה ונטפליקס. המחיר מאוד אטרקטיבי ביחס לדירות אחרות.

כמה חסרונות:

אין חניה פרטית, וחניה ציבורית מאוד קשה למצוא. וחניה ציבורית צריך להפעיל פנגו / סלופארק מחדש כל שעתיים במהלך שעות היום (8:00־19:00)

כפי שאחרים ציינו לפניי, המיקום של הדירה על המדרחוב הוא יתרון משמעותי במהלך היום מבחינת קרבה נוחה לכל מקום, אבל חיסרון גדול בלילה מבחינת רעש. היה רועש עד השעות הקטנות של הלילה ולא קל להירדם. לקחנו את הסיכון למרות זאת.

מבחינת היחידה, לא היה כל־כך ברור לנו שהמטבח משותף עם יחידות אחרות. לנו זה לא הפריע אבל כדאי להיות מודעים.

השירותים והמקלחת היו צפופים אבל זה לא בעיה גדולה.
נהדר
מיקום מעולה. מאד נקי ומזמין. כדאי לאטום טוב יותר את החלון שמעל הפאבים כי הרעש מפריע... חוצמזה החדר היה מצוין. תמורה הולמת למחיר

המקום במיקום מצוין, יחד עם זאת מאחורי הבנין יש מקומות בילוי והחלונות לא חוסמים רעשים באף צורה. לא יכלנו לישון כל הלילה.
בנוסף, הסדינים לא נראו נקיים והיו עם ריח של סיגריות והמיטות לא נוחות.
לא הייתי חוזרת שוב.
reviews.response:
תודה רבה אור שמחתי לארח אתכם.
אני והצוות שלי עושים מאמצים רבים על מנת שחווית האירוח תהייה הטובה ביותר שאפשר.
אקח לתשומת ליבי את הביקורת ואפעל על מנת לשפר את הדברים.
תודה רבה

description: By the ancient wall lays a hidden stone gem.Around the corner from the main square in the jewish quarter. Near the lively arab market, 4 min to Holy seplecer, 6 min to the Kotel. Our home is cozy, well equiped  and can host a couple or a family.The spaceThe bedroom can sleep two adults compfortably. in the living room the sofa bed opens for 2 additional adults. a cot can be provided for a 5th person.Guest access4 stairs from the street, to a first floor appartment. guests will have a fully private access to kitchen bathrooms and courtyard.Other things to noteTwo mini markets and many fast food places with in 1 minute walking from the appartment. Small play ground by the courtyard.
additional_house_rules: Please repect the neighborhood and keep the peace during the night and the Sabbath.
interaction: We will be glad to meet you at the appartment or at the jewish quarter parking lot (and escort you to the house), if needed. we would be glad to give recomandations and point you to the right directions or leave you be to enjoy your vacation.
transit: all main holy and tourists sights in thy old city are within easy walking distance of the appartment.  Public transportation (bus and light train) within 5-15 minutes walk, easy taxi services near by.

reviews.comments: Great apartment. Perfect for 2. Roomy kitchen/dinning area. We even had a Nespresso Machine with Pods to use. Yehudit had delicious rolls and some fruit and vegetables waiting for us when we arrived. Even fresh milk in the refrigerator.  Comfortable beds (2 separate beds next to each other to combine as a larger bed - as is common in Israel). Great location, in the Jewish Quarter,  just a very short walk from the main "square" of the Jewish Quarter. We would definitely stay again.
reviews.response: tha,ks for the nice words/ I came to my place and there is no sign that you were there. (Website hidden by Airbnb) hope that you will come again.

reviews.comments: A gem in the heart of the Old City! Steps away from the shops, restaurants, a playground and the Kotel. Nice private outdoor sitting area. We really enjoyed our stay and Yehudit made sure we had everything we needed. Can’t wait to come back again!
The best in the Old City. Excellent amenities and everything you need for a fantastic, warm, peaceful stay. Yehudit thinks of everything. Highly recommended.
Great location and great host.

The Stone Gem, Yehudit's apartment, is ideally located in the Jewish Quarter of the Old City. The closest parking is an easy five minute walk away. The apartment is well supplied with furniture, linens, kitchen equipment, washer, dryer, even a private patio. When we asked if a blender would be available to make smoothies, Yehudit not only got one for our use, but two different types. She thoughtfully supplied additional items to make our stay very comfortable. Not being Jewish ourselves, we still found it easy to be respectful of this kosher apartment. An individual, a couple or a small family would find the Stone Gem a perfect apartment for their stay in the Old City.
If we have the opportunity to visit again, we would quickly try to reserve this place.
reviews.response: Thank you very much. hope to see you again

reviews.comments: Dear Yeudit,it was great stay,thank you for your hospitality

Yehudit was an incredible hostess! She had everything we could possibly need in her apartment and the place was beautiful and clean. She was quick to respond to our messages and was extremely friendly and helpful. We would recommend anyone to go there! This place is a steal for what you are getting!

Sorry that I could only add one favorite thing. Not only is Yehudit’s & her husband’s hospitality exceptional  but so were the little touches and the cleanliness.  Everything you need is there.   They went out of their way to make sure that we had everything we needed. This is our second visit & hope to make a third sometime next year.  Thank you!!!
reviews.response:
Shalom Elaine
Thanks for your nice words, Hope to see you soon

Shana tova

Yehudit

reviews.comments: This apartment is awesome and the host was wonderful. Came and met me near the apartment to make sure I found it easily, showed me the neighborhood, bought snacks ahead of time, even arranged an early (5:30am) taxi and met me that morning to make sure I made it out without problems. 5-star service and kindness! Whenever I return, I'll definitely hope to stay here again.

Amazing location, lovely, private space. Plenty of room, great shower and kitchen. Yehudit is sweet and accommodating, everything you need for Shabbat within steps of the Wall. We were amazingly fortunate to find this place and will be back!

My family and I had an amazing Shabbat at Yehudit's place ! The apartment had everything we needed and was super clean and tidy . We were also very comfortable . She even got a crib for my baby which I really appreciated ! Everything was just perfect .
Yehudit's flat is very comfortable. It is in a perfect location for touring the Old City. The bed was devine and we felt very much at home in her place.
reviews.response: thanks

reviews.comments: Yehudit was a gracious host and accommodated us for space for guests for our son's bar mitzvah. Our communication with her was prompt and helpful and since we did not get a complaint from our guests  we know that it lived up to our expectations.

Yehudit was a wonderful host. She met us at the entrance, helped with the luggage, had a lovely fruit bowl on the table, showed us around then left.   The location is beyond amazing.  For us it was near everything that was important to us. We were sad to leave & but plan on returning
Fantastic place in the heart of the Jewish quarter. Gives a real feel for the old city. Highly recommend!

The apartment was an amazing location, very near the Hurva Synagogue and just a few minute walk to the Kotel (western wall). Yehudit was an amazing and very accommodating hostess, even helping us bring our luggage to the apartment.
Be aware that you cannot get a taxi or car directly to the apartment due to the location in the old city, so you will have to walk at least a few minutes from any drop off point to get to the apartment. The apartment itself is on street level so you won't have to lug a suitcase up many steps.
The apartment itself is decent sized for one in the old city (2 toilets, a shower, washer/dryer, even a private small walled in courtyard though we did not go there due to the poor weather during our stay).
To review, perfect location, great price for the location and quality of the accommodation, and Yehudit is amazing! Highly recommended!
reviews.response: Dear Rachel and family,I had a good time hosting you, thank you for your many kind words. I do hope you come back and stay at my apartment again when you visit next.

reviews.comments: Location Location Location!!!!!! My family and I enjoyed our stay immensely. The apartment was minutes away from the kotel and shopping. The apartment was clean, bright and comfortable. Yehudit, made us feel welcomed and really put thought into every detail. I look forward to future visits to the  Old City and would definitely stay in this apartment again.

We had a great stay at Yehudit place close to the city centre! The apartment is very well located close to every places to visit. The apartment itself is spacious, comfortable with all commodities you need. Yehudit and her son gave us a warm welcome as well as precious information. We will not hesitate to come back to Yehudit place if we travel again to Jerusalem.
reviews.response:
Dear julie
thanks for the warm words. Hope to see you again

happy new year

Yehudit

reviews.comments: A clean well located gem indeed!
The host canceled this reservation 192 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Yehudit's place is located in a wonderful position: in the centre of Jewish quarter, making it is easy to reach every place you want to visit in Jerusalem. Just walking! The apartment is very big, well equipped (wonderful coffee machine) and very silent despite being in the centre. This was very much appreciated being there with a baby... Our baby also appreciated the playground just behind the house! Yehudit welcomes you with delicious home made and is at disposal for everything. Thank you again! Definitely recommended.
reviews.response: ths very much. Hope to have you again. Many kisses to the sweet baby

reviews.comments: Yehudit was a perfect hostess. She picked us up at the nearest taxi stand, and made sure we got a good rate. She left info in the apt for us too. The location is A1 in the heart of the Old City. Apt was very clean, quiet, secure and air conditioned. Beds and pillows were comfy. We will return.

Everything was as detailed in the listing. Yehudit welcomed us to the Old City by meeting us at the bus station and walked us to her place. Great location in Jewish Quarter 3-4 minute walk max to the Western Wall. Close to shops for lunch and groceries.  Had a great time.

We had a perfect weekend in a heart of Jerusalem,thanks to Yehudit. We were supposed to meet her at 12.00. but we were late because of buses. Instead of yelling at us, she welcomed us with some strawberries and cookies. She occured to be a really kind, funny and easy-going person. We were amazed by her hospitality and her well-located, redecorated, modern and beautiful apartment. It took only 5 minutes to the Western Wall from her apartment, which was crucial for us. We got everything that we needed, more than enough, to be exact, a lot of extra things, like espresso machine, air-conditioning, balcony and so on. We are definitely looking forward to come back to Jersualem and stay at her place again.

name: Studio in the heart of the Old City

description: In a beautiful historically listed building in the heart of the Old City of Jerusalem, in a pedestrian area, close to the Temple Mount, The Church of the Holy Sepulchre, the Jaffa Gate, the Tower of David and Mamilla Mall.Beautiful large terrace .

reviews.comments: Love this place. Beautiful, light-filled space with an authentic old Jerusalem feel in an amazing location in the heart of the Old City. Cozy but feels spacious, especially with the spiral stairs going up to the big, sunny roof terrace overlooking the Church of the Holy Sepulchre and surrounds. Very quiet at night and wonderful hosts, quick communication and very helpful.

The space is as described. It's a bit difficult to find (the Old City is very twisty, and I am awful with directions ;) but that is part of the fun (and the hosts were very helpful with giving me directions via phone!). Staying in such an amazing location in the middle of ancient history is incredible! The apartment itself was clean, comfortable, and the extra heater kept it warm enough even on cold nights with stone walls. As reviewers mentioned, you have to duck to enter the bathroom, but I did not have any issues navigating it - and I'm tall and a bit klutzy. :p Showering was also totally fine and there was plenty of hot water. I did not find it noisy as some reviewers described - staying in the touristy hotels on Jaffa Street would be MUCH noisier! The apartment was peaceful and relaxing and really the perfect place if you want to stay in the Old City in a safe area. Definitely recommend :)

This cozy apartment is simple but in an amazing location near anything you want to do in the Old City. Myriam was very accommodating about our needs, and responded immediately to our communications. Very glad we chose her place for our stay. Oh, and only a ten-minute walk from the City Hall tram stop.
Great location not far from the Jaffa Gate. Good heat and hot water. Bathroom is tiny but you know that going in. Friendly host.
Quiet, family-oriented respite from the close-by tourist-madness of the old city.
Myriam's place was fantastic.  It was great for the two of us, with the amazing outdoor space and the lovely weather in the evenings it was truly a blessing.

Thank you for the amazing accommodation- Not only does the studio provide a clean, relaxing environment, it also is the ideal location to explore everything in the Old City and beyond. What, truly, makes life much easier are the gracious hosts.
Thanks again!
I hope to see you again soon!
Host was accommodating. Place in perfect location and as described.

Terrible place in the Armenian quarter of the old city. The place was inaccurately described. There is no stove. You cannot shower. The bathroom sink is so small you can't use it without getting water everywhere. The so-called shoer rod was broken and not fixed. Bugs fly in if you open the windows as there are bugs and there are no screens. There is a fair amount of garbage in the courtyard and the adjacent passageways. There is inadequate heat/the heaters don't work properly. One heater was unsafe with  a frayed cord. There is a lot of garbage and household noise around. The curtains do not fit the size of the two windows. The host are unresponsive. The host charges too much.
reviews.response:
Amy broke the shower curtain, put to much electric devise on a electrical power strip and burn it and unplug the heater to ask a refund because "it was to cold". Weird ! I definitely don't want her back.

She check in a nice warm room with everything working fine (with 2 heaters, one on the ground and one on the wall, and the walls are also very thick) (just see the reviews before her). In short, she unplugged the heater and then asked for a refund. I don't know if it is weird or funny !!! Then, she accept to plug the floor's heater but put so much electric devise on a power strip which has burned. I changed it.

I didn't mind washing all she sheet with a special product as she asked me because she has high sensitivity to smell , nor letting her check in and check out earlier and latter, I try to be flexible, but trying to trick a host to have a refund ... it's going too far.

reviews.comments: Great location. It’s nice and peaceful..
Perfect location for exploring Jerusalem's Old City.
The perfect environment to experience life in the old city!!!
Amazing location to experience the spiritual and physical realities of Old Jerusalem.
Amazing Apartment!!!
Wonderful location and very friendly neighbors.  Staying in the Old City and wandering the streets early in the morning is great!
I wished I had more time to stay there.

Why stay at the Waldorf Astoria when you can stay here?  Shabbos and a week in the old city is a spiritual vacation that cannot be matched and this apartment provided all the physical comforts we needed.  I highly recommend staying here.

This is a great place for solo or couples travelers who want to explore the Old City. Myriam and her husband Ephraim were excellent hosts, and contrary to one of the other reviews I read, I found everyone in the complex was very nice. It is all you need when you're traveling to explore the Old City, and, as Ephraim recommended to me, it is great to just sit on the rooftop terrace with some dates and a cup of coffee or glass of wine and marvel at the stunning views. Highly recommended!
This is a great place to stay in the Old City. Close to everything and only a short walk from transportation. Myriam was very easy to communicate and quick to respond.

This apartment is located right in the old city, inside the Jewish quarter. It is extremely convenient for exploring the city and you get a feel for Jerusalem you simply wouldn't in a hotel. The apartment was clean and is inside a residential compound, up a flight of stairs. The street outside isn't very busy. There is a small kitchen / general area, 2 beds next to each other, table and a bathroom. I really couldn't find a better deal in the old city and we were not disappointed. You simply can't beat 5 minutes walk to Western Wall plaza or 10 to the Via Delarosa.

This studio was a wonderful place to stay. One room with one bathroom. A door with a spiral staircase up to the terrace.  We found the two twin beds to be very comfortable. The kitchenette was great for using the frig and making morning coffee. We sat on the terrace often. The courtyard that the studio is in is a wonderful safe feeling and like being part of a little household. Children playing, piano being practiced, conversations happening. Bird calls and church bells and prayer call could all be heard. The location is fantastic. Everything you want to see in the old city is minutes away and yet you also feel off  the beaten path.  This is our favorite type of rental. Not like a hotel at all, just a cozy home to come back to. The heat was great. The tiny bathroom was quite fun to use. Many restaurants nearby.

The ubiquitous real estate mantra - location, location, location - has probably been true since the founding of Jerusalem. And this place has location! It's a unique experience to actually stay in the old city just steps from markets and thousands of years of history. The apartment was very comfortable for two people and had plenty of hot water in the shower. If you have a car, parking in the Mamilla mall parking structure next to Jaffa gate is very convenient and surprisingly affordable per day.
Great place to stay in the old city of Jerusalem. Minutes from all the sites, very cozy, and we'll within anyone's budget.

Great, unique location in the heart of the Jewish quarter. Well-stocked, easy to get to studio. The rooftop terrace views and living were phenomenal! Seconds away from the Western wall, Temple Mount, etc.   Overall, fantastic!
reviews.response: It was nice to have you at our place, our little girls loved the drawing you left them. Thanks and come back soon.

reviews.comments: Myriam was responsive and the rental was generally as described. It was a great experience overall, and the view of the Christian quarter from the terrace is nice.  The unit was advertised as having a washer and dryer, but I did not realize until I arrived that the washer and dryer is the host!  She provided full service laundry which was fairly convenient.

Myriam's place is gorgeous and at a great location in the Old City. It is a convenient walk to Jaffa Gate. It's small, but it is cozy and perfectly comfortable. Miriam speaks French, which was an advantage for me. The only drawback was carrying luggage into the Old City without being able to use a taxi can be a hassle.

Cute studio, fantastic location - it makes the perfect home base to explore the city.  Myriam and her family are very kind and just next door if you need anything.   Bed is 2 twins pushed together, and there is a small cook plate, kettle, fridge, and microwave that we used to prep meals to keep our costs down.  We were very happy with our stay.

This is a charming small apartment, with a vaulted ceiling, in a historic courtyard building, in the heart of Jerusalem Old Walled City. Myriam and Ephraim, who live next door with their family, were charming and helpful hosts. Altogether a wonderful experience.
Compact and cozy apartment in the middle of the Old City.  Heater was a nice touch and kept the place perfectly warm in December weather.

This is a very reasonably priced studio apartment in a great location.  The apartment was very clean and the host was always responsive to our queries.  The apartment was just large enough for me any my two teenage children.  The bathroom is compact but fully functional.  There is sufficient amenities to make breakfast.

We had a great stay in this appartment in the Old Town. A little bit of privat feeling between the jewish life. It is small, but big enough for us ( three persons). The roof top was amazing, Myriam very kind, the beds very good and the little bathroom totaly ok. We recommend this place, because your are not in the middle of thousands of tourist groups!

Functional, no-fuss apartment, some twenty steps up from a quiet courtyard, well located in the Armenian quarter and very close to the Jewish quarter of the old city (St. Mark's Chapel around the corner). It includes a generous spot on a roof terrace with a view over parts of the old city (mostly churches and mosques but no view to the Temple Mount or famous Jewish sites such as the Hurva synagogue or the Western Wall). Two single iron beds pushed together, slowly and impalpably moving, surprising you with a steady canyon expanding throughout the night :-). Be careful when accessing the tiny bathroom under the five foot low arch if you want to avoid seeing stars. The kitchen nook is equipped with a two plate stove, microwave, water kettle, a hot water urn, a warming plate and a small fridge. No TV (not necessarily a disadvantage!). No washer and no dryer in the apartment but access through the host. Generally speaking, accommodation in this part of Jerusalem, specifically in the Jewish quarter is expensive. Still, the total cost of 300 US per night, fees included (we stayed three nights during the Jewish holiday of Shavuot), for a rather basic israeli-style one-room apartment is overpriced (this is part of the unfortunate trend in Israel that you often get two or three-star quality but pay four or five-star prices). The apartment is difficult to reach since there are no transportation possibilities. No buses, no taxis (which is a plus if you look for peace but a minus if you are older and/or mobility impaired). Depending on how long you plan to stay, or whether you need to carry food with you,  you have to walk a few times back and forth with your suitcases through immensely charming narrow alleys with slippery steps. The nearest parking lot is about 1 km away, which costs 60 NIS or 17 US a day.  This needs to be added to your expense. So altogether, if you are not too picky and don't mind the extra bucks for the location it is still a good choice.
reviews.response:
Thank you Chaim for your appreciation .

Indeed we are in the middle on the old city of Jerusalem, a pedestrian quarter, with an astonishing view of all the rooftop of the christian quarter.

We are situated in the boarder of Armenian quater.

We usually keep modest price for a great situated place ( the only exception being the Jewish feast of Chavouot)

reviews.comments:
Charming flat in a part of the old city which has lots of athmosphere. Impressive view from roof terrace.
Nice and helpful hostess who speaks good English and even French.
Isabelle and Nils

A small and very nice studio for two in the heart of the Jewish quarter in the old city of Jerusalem. Myriam ist a friendly host, and the location is great to explore the old city in detail. We enjoyed our visit very much !

Beautiful, clean studio in the heart of the Old City. It is very close to all main sights, yet in a quiet, calm street. The location is perfect and we loved the unique atmosphere of the small courtyard. Communication with Myriam was smooth and easy. Would definitely stay there again.
A perfect location, a well equipped studio and a great terrace with a perfect view!

Myriam's room is perfectly positioned for a stay in the old city. Right in the centre  but in a quiet back street, the room had everything we needed, including friendly neighbours. We were unlucky with the weather, but the heating worked well, and there were plenty of warm bed covers.The kitchen area allowed us to make our breakfast. The small bathroom worked well, and there was always plenty of hot water. We loved the terrace, and wished the weather had allowed us to use it more. We enjoyed eating at the Armenian Tavern around the corner, and had some excellent chicken wraps and coffee up at Jaffa Gate. A comfortable spot to stay!
The host canceled this reservation 130 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

For our needs absolutly perfect, small and cosy, nice smelling room, with very easy kitchen and'ecomomicly' solved bathroom. Enought warm water, hairdryer, nice towels, extra coverings, own entrance to terase(shared just with owners), fastatic little courtyard and...main in winter...good working warming:) view from terase amazing- to Church of Sepultury:)) The miniflat is very near to main David street, next a St.Markus church. Comunication great and easy (without Shabbat time). Good wifi. Friendly neighborows. We hope we have chance again return:)

Massively recommend this apartment. In the heart of the Old Town it is a stone throw away from the the Tower of David, the Western Wall, the Church of the Holy Sepulchre and everything else you’d want to see and explore in Jerusalem. It is in a quiet side street, has everything you need including a lovely roof terrace overlooking the old town - just outstanding.

Excellent

Everything was perfect.
Everything was super nice super clean was awsome.
Location was very convenient.

Myriam’s place is a little gem. It is small, but all you need for a couple. The location is superb, right in the heart of the old city. The roof top space is surprisingly large and a pleasant area to sit out when it is warm.

Simple accommodation in a wonderful location, in a great part of a fantastic city ... reasonably easy to find amongst the twists and turns of the Jewish quarter, an easy walk into the markets and all of the sites, it was brilliant to spend some time within the walled old city that is Jerusalem.

Myriam’s apartment is the best location that you can find in Jerusalem! Clean and well equipped with one extraordinary terrace view on the old city. Having breakfast admiring all the important domes, during the morning muezzin prayer is stunning! The communication was precise and really fast! She is a real super host!

If you would like to explore the Old City of Jerusalem, this is a good location that has everything you need, so long as you don't mind stairs. The bathroom area is small but functional and I was very pleased to have shower and toilet on the same level as the room. We enjoyed our stay here.

Lovely studio a few steps from the Holy Sepulchre Church. The Studio is more designed for two guests, because for the third guest offer small and not comfortable sofa.
Beautiful view from the terrace on domes and roofs of the Old City of Jerusalem.
This is not a quiet place, because the owners have a lot of children and they make noise from morning to evening, but it did not bother us, as we walked a lot and came only to spend the night.
In any case, this is a great studio for overnight stay and sightseeing!
Thank you Mariam!
reviews.response:
Thank you for your great appreciation.

I rented you the place for two persons and you could't come so you ask me if I didn't mind if people you knew could come in your place. I accepted and also added, free of charge, a third sofa bed. If your friends have asked a comfortable bed, I could have provided them with no problem. They just have to asked.

Regarding the noise, your friends came during the week of Easter (pessah) during witch not only children are on holidays but people gather from all around the world in Jerusalem Christians and Jews. Like your friend saw the neighborhood was unusually crowded but it was nice. Even for this time of the year we are relatively quitter than the other part of the old city. (And even my children usually go to school and to then to ballet school from 7am to 8pm, after witch it is bed time).

Hope to see you soon at our place.

reviews.comments: The appartment is located in Old City in a quite street of Armenian district, very close to all attractions.  If you come by car, you have to leave it in the parking lot outside of city and go with luggage by feet.  However, we knew about it in advance and this was our choice because living inside the Old City is worth such a small inconvenience.  The teracce with great view is big.  The appartment has everything you need for a couple of days. Myriam and her husband are living just the next door to the appartment and were more than helpful, when we required any assistance.  Something happened to electricity in the morning and it could be fixed only in the evening because of Shabbat.  It can happen everywhere and with evryone so we didn't complain and asked for any discount but our hosts decided themsleves to give the discount to us.  And we appreciated very much such a great customer service approach. I would highly recommend this appartment to everyone (excluding disabled and old people because of stairs from the yard to the flat and from flat to teracce).
Very good place in a very good location.

Myriam's place was everything we were hoping for. It's a short walk to to the Holy Sepulchre, the Western Wall and the Temple Mount. It's also very close to both the Jaffa and Zion gates where there are lots of shops and restaurants. The unit itself is clean and comfortable and the rooftop terrace is amazing. I would highly recommend this place to anyone wanting to stay inside the Old City!
Amazing spot for checking out the old city. Easy check in. Great host!

The location was very central and staying in a Jewish compound was interesting. The roof terrace was beautiful and sunsets outstanding, I was able to do a sketch of the scene.
Overall we had a good stay and the room was comfortable. I would say that the host was neither friendly nor unfriendly and room preparations were fine. The host lived nearby which was good though we didn't see her throughout the stay and the host didn't make an effort to help with luggage up difficult steps or show us the room, merely pointing us to it. My sense was that not all members of the compound were sold on having AIRBNB guests in their compound which is understandable. We were regarded variably with curiosity and suspicion from those were not the host and naturally there are cultural differences to be aware of, this being quite an orthodox residence.
Overall I would still very recommend the place as its unique in being able to stay in Old Jerusalem and the roof terrace is worth it.
reviews.response: Shane you are always welcome in our place. Being close to the studio, we always find time for our guests when they need it, otherwise we let them be inspire by this extraordinary new atmosphere. In the compound we all come from various backgrounds and place in the world : France, England, United Stades, Germany and Israel... we share our differences with peace, love and comprehension with our Armenians neighbors.

reviews.comments: We were happy to use the apartments. The apartment we had everything we needed. Apartments in the heart of Jerusalem's old city, very convenient for walking. The hostess was friendly and polite! Miriam, we had a great stay, thank you!!!

Monolocale in centro alla città vecchia di Gerusalemme, al piano primo con accesso da una scala nel cortile.
Ben tenuto e pulito, letto comodo, lenzuola ed asciugamani forniti e pure questi puliti.
Arredamento non nuovissimo ma in più che buone condizioni.
Il bagno abbastanza piccolo con lavandino di dimensioni ridotte, volendo comunque si può utilizzare il lavandino della cucina molto più grande. In bagno manca lo specchio, mentre un grande specchio è nella stanza da letto / soggiorno.
Da una porta chiusa a chiave si accede a scala interna, in comune con la famiglia proprietaria, che conduce alla terrazza dalla quale si gode di una stupenda vista panoramica su parte della città vecchia. Prima della terrazza c'è un altro bagno a disposizione degli ospiti con doccia molto più grande e lavandino con specchio.
In zona centrale ma calma e di notte molto silenzioso.
Internet WI FI sempre funzionante e molto veloce.
La famiglia proprietaria molto gentile, disponibile e discreta.
Good location and comfortable, There is very nice roof on the top with a wonderful view
Zentral gelegene kleine Wohnung mit phantastischem Blick von der Dachterrasse. Freundliche Gastgeber.

Un sitio muy adecuado para visitar lugares de Jerusalém, está muy céntrico, el departamento está muy bien adecuado. Los anfitriónes Myriam y Efrain muy amables, lindos y muy pendientes. Les recomiendo mucho ahí he encontrado mucha paz.

Super Lage mitten in der Altstadt, alles sehr nah und zu Fuß zu erreichen. Die Wohnung hat alles was man braucht. Sehr sauber und schön eingerichtet. Besonderes Highlight ist die Benutzungsmöglichkeit der Dachterrasse mit Blick über die Altstadt.

Das Zimmer ist fantastisch mitten in der Altstadt gelegen, aber es ist trotzdem ruhig. Es ist ziemlich klein, aber sauber, alles da, was man braucht, und die freundlichen Besitzer wohnen nebenan. Das Bad ist tatsächlich winzig, aber wir hatten damit gar kein Problem, da alles bestens funktionierte. Uns hat vielleicht ein bisschen gestört, dass direkt an den Fenstern der Zugang zu der Nachbarwohnung liegt, weshalb wir lieber über die anderen - kleinen - Fenster gelüftet haben, was such ok war. Zur Dachterrasse gelangt man über eine Wendeltreppe. Ich kann die Unterkunft vor allem wegen der guten Lage in der Altstadt von Jerusalem empfehlen. Den Preis finde ich allerdings zu hoch, aber das scheint in Jerusalem Standard zu sein.

Le studio est très bien placé, presque au centre des 4 quartiers. Myriam est très accueillante et très discrète. La vue de la terrasse (sur le Saint Sépulcre) est époustouflante. Toute la vieille ville de Jérusalem est accessible en quelques minutes à pied.

Eine wundervolle Möglichkeit in die Altstadt von Jerusalem einzutauchen. Perfekte Lage mitten in der Altstadt in einem historischen, malerischen Haus. Besonders die Dachterrasse mit Blick auf die Grabeskirche ist atemberaubend und v.a. abends eine Oase . Betten waren sehr gemütlich. Alles in allem absolut empfehlenswert.
Nous avons été très bien accueilli par Myriam. Le logement est idéalement situé pour visiter le vieux Jérusalem, bien équipé et où on y dort bien (literie et calme) !

wspaniała lokalizacja, klimatyczne miejsce, jeśli nocleg w Jerozolimie to tylko w obrębie starych murów, wszędzie bliziutko (a tarasu widać Bazylikę Grobu Pańskiego). Miriam bardzo komunikatywna i pomocna. niezapomniany pobyt

super emplacement et des hotes très sympa . Des modifications de couchages de dernière minutes nous ont permis de ne pas être a l étroit !
une terrasse a la vue extraordinaire.
je recommande

Parfait pour profiter de la vieille ville de Jérusalem. Terrasse magique à toute heure !
Lionel
Logement idéalement situé, tout se fait à pied. Myriam est très accueillante, le studio est parfait pour deux, au calme et proche de tout, et d'une propreté irréprochable.

Accueil fort sympathique. Le logement est propre, typique avec ses portes basses et ses arches, bien équipé, literie très confortable,  accès à une terrasse, mais surtout très bien situé au cœur de la vieille ville dans le quartier arménien à 2 pas des quartiers juif, chrétien et musulman ainsi qu'à 5 minutes de la porte de Jaffa. Notre hôte joue admirablement bien du piano, nous avons apprécié nous éveiller dans cette atmosphère musicale. Une expérience que nous renouvellerions sans hésiter dans ce même logement!

Wir fanden das Appartment super! Geniale ruhige Lage in der Altstadt, zu Fuß alles gut erreichbar. Die Terrasse mit herrlicher Aussicht haben wir geliebt! Die Gastgeber gleich neben an waren immer für uns erreichbar und sehr freundlich.
Das Auto parkten wir im mamilla mall parking gegenüber vom Jaffagate, preislich okay und schnell zu erreichen. Sehr empfehlenswert! Tania & Magnus

Accueil chaleureux et agréable. Le studio est similaire aux photos et la terrasse sur le toi très agréable avec un jolie vue. Le quartier est agréable, a 2 pas de la porte de Jaffa et des commerces. Myriam est vraiment quelqu'un de très agréable, serviable et discrète et sa famille est adorable.
Merci encore à Myriam pour ce séjour, nous garderons l'adresse.

description: Welcome to our brand new, quiet and cozy apartment in the heart of Jerusalem!  This beautiful home on Mahané Yehuda and Jaffa Street is waiting for you to come relax and enjoy a vacation with your loved ones. The apartment has all necessities and luxuries to make sure your stay is perfect. Just a few steps away from endless restaurants, bars, and shopping and the western wall.The spaceLocated in the center of Jerusalem, this beautiful apartment is the perfect place for a family vacation or a business trip.The feeling you get when you walk into the apartment is that you are entering a very charming and quiet place where you can relax and take a break from the hectic urban life. Giving you the feeling of a real holiday with 1 cozy bedroom, a large and comfortable open-concept kitchen, and a bright dining room. The apartment has a clean, spacious, and fully equipped kitchen with all modern facilities. Including a fridge, microwave, oven, coffee machine, stove and plenty of counter space.The bedroom is furnished with a big, comfortable bed and closet for your comfort and convenience And a nice and spacious bathroom.AC, TV, WiFi are available as well as a washing machine and a hairdryer. Everything you might need is just down the street. There are lots of stores, restaurants, bars and coffee shops around the apartment Overall this is a great apartment to host friends and families, very comfortable and safe, amazing central location with gorgeous views. It is in the very center of Jerusalem and has everything you need within easy reach, from restaurants and shops to cultural activities.Guest accessThe whole apartment is at your disposal for a pleasant stay.  You will have access to a fully equipped kitchen, free Wi-Fi connection all amenities are at your disposal. Kitchen appliances are included as well as the washing machine and A/C unit. The apartment comes with fresh towels and bedsheetsOther things to noteWe have multiple apartment in the same buildings including communicant apartments perfect for groups or family events A private parking in the building can be arranged for 70 shekels per dayIsraeli citizens will be required to pay an additional 17% for the VAT
additional_house_rules: Israeli citizens will be required to pay an additional 17% for the VAT
interaction: We are always available for you, either in person, by email, phone or messages.We provide you with all the information you require to have a pleasant stay and ultimate peace of mind.We would be happy to answer all your questions and provide recommendations for your stay. We speak English, French, Hebrew and Russian. If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to ask.
transit: All public transportation (Tramway, Train, Bus, Taxi) are at the door of the building or within minutes of apartment.

name: Apartement 4 people’s mamilla/king david
amenities: Essentials - Towels, bed sheets, soap, and toilet paper

description: Appartement au deuxième étage d’un immeuble ancien de plus de 100 ans classé monument historique au coeur de Jérusalem, dans le fabuleux quartier de  Mamilla situé face aux très célèbres hôtels King David et David Citadel, plus exactement au 18 king david street sans doute la plus prestigieuse et plus central rue de Jérusalem.The spaceL’appartement est composé d’un séjour confortable, d’une cuisine entièrement équipée et moderne, d’une chambre spacieuse et d’une salle de bain tout confort.Joliment aménagé et doté d’une décoration tendance il se situe au N°18 de la très prestigieuse rue King David Street dans le célèbre quartier de Mamila à deux pas de tout les sites touristique de Jérusalem.Dans un immeuble en pierre de Jérusalem, datant du début des années 1900, témoins de toute l’histoire de ce site historique depuis plus de 100 ans vous vous sentirez vraiment à Jérusalem dans cet authentique endroit chargé d’histoire.Autrefois appelé « St Julian’s Hotel » (1930) cette bâtisse a était entièrement rénovée et repensé pour vous recevoir dans les meilleurs conditions.Équipé d’une connexion wi-fi gratuit à haut débit  et de la télévision écran plat vous aurez à disposition dans cet appartement toutes les commodités nécessaires et moderne dont dont vous aurez besoin (Machine à laver, séchoir, table et fer à repasser,  sèche-cheveux...)Nos lits et matelas, draps serviettes et tout le linge de maison sont de qualités supérieurs.Nous mettons à votre disposition des produits de toilette pour votre arrivée ( Shampooing gel douche papier WC lessive etc...)Idéal pour les petites  familles ou les voyageurs solitaire, pour vos déplacement professionnel ou touristique cet appartement moderne et fonctionnel fera de votre séjour à Jérusalem une aventure extraordinaire.Pour toute demande spéciale complémentaires n’hésitez pas à nous solliciter et nous mettrons tout en œuvre pour vous satisfaire (kosher, plata, kumkum, chek-out motzei shabbat ...)Guest accessles voyageurs ont acces à tous le logement.Malheureusement pour le moment notre établissement ne dispose pas d’ascenseur , ni   d’accès pour personnes à mobilité réduite compte tenu de son âge et son architecture.les voyageurs ont un accès internet par WIFI illimité, un lieu de culte juive au premier étage, climatisation, chauffage. Un parking est disponible à 100 m de l'immeuble pour le prix de 35 NIS/ Jour
