description: If location & privacy are of value to you - this is the place for you!A bright, clean and cozy studio apartment on a big private roof, with the view and the air of Jerusalem, at the center of the city!No additional charges.The spaceThe Best location in the city - central & quiet. At the back of the great synagogue. The studio apartment is  furnished and equipped and has all appliances you need. The studio has a double bed with an orthopedic mattress , tv screen, a Functional kitchen, a dining table for 2. There is a big double shower in the bathroom. You can go out to a covered pergola with a dining sitting area, or enjoy the big green terrace of the private roof.we provide you:* Full privacy!* Quiet in a very central place.* An equipped kitchen includes a refrigerator,microwave, oven,      electric kettle and a hot plate, kitchenware* Coffee, tea & sugar, salt & pepper.* Flat screen TV (with many many movies),* Free WIFI internet access at all spaces.* Big Rain shower* Clean linen & towels* Hairdryer, iron* Air conditioning / heat Big private terrace/sun roof with:* Dining table & chairs.  * sunbeds.* shadeGuest accessOur guests are free to enjoy a big private terraceFree WIFI in and out the unitFree private parking  (Although when you are our guest you do not need a car at all, everything is within walking distance!)Other things to notecheck-in  (14:00 PM noon) and check-out (10 AM)  - are flexible and depends whether there is no other reservation.
additional_house_rules:
No smoking inside!
I  expect my guests to be mindful of my neighbors, to Keep quiet and clean at all spaces of the building.
Over 4 days of stay, I kindly ask my guest to wet the flowers.
I ask for passport number when booking (For tax free).
interaction: we personally received and welcome our guests. We live in the building so we always nearby to  ensure your stay is an enjoyable experience!We are happy to help you plan your trip to Israel, give you useful tips how to spend the best time in Jerusalem.   Please don't hesitate to ask any question, we are here to help!
transit: We have a private parking in the building, you can use,  Although when you are our guest, you do not need a car or public transit at all - everything is within walking distance!

reviews.comments: We had a great time staying at this property.  The rooftop patio is terrific.  We spent most of our time out there.  Great location in the heart of Jerusalem.  Efrat is a wonderful hostess.   If the opportunity comes, we would stay there again.

This apartment is perfect in every way! The best neighborhood in Jerusalem, a secure and friendly building with elevator, a hugh 5th floor rooftop terrace all to yourself, comfortable accommodations, and everything you need for a great holiday. It is a short walk to many restaurants and a well stocked supermarket.
Pictures and description of the apartment and terrace are very accurate. You are right around the corner from the largest synagogue in the world, and it is lovely to sit out on the terrace and hear the singing coming from The Great Synogogue while watching the wild green parrots fly in the trees around you (I think they are parrots??). And best of all are the wonderful, attentive, helpful hosts. Don’t hesitate to stay here when you come to Jerusalem, it is so much better then a hotel stay.

My girlfriend and I stayed from May 19-June 16 at this treetop level studio apartment perfectly located to explore the great sights of Jerusalem on foot. Fifteen minute walk to the Old City and to the City Center restaurant area, 20 minutes to Mahane Yehuda market as well as to Ben Yehuda street shops and restaurant area. The private whole-rooftop patio with the the treetop view and morning bird show was spectacular--including a group of 4 green ring-necked parakeets (as we learned via (Hidden by Airbnb) ) and the view and wonderful cool breeze after a hot day of touring made the apartment a welcome retreat to come home to after a hot day of touring!

The studio apt itself really is quite small, but in the morning and evening when it is cool, we opened the door to the patio area and it felt much bigger. We unpacked our clothes using the shelves and clothes bar inside and stored our luggage out on the patio, which worked fine. The mini refrigerator was a bit of a challenge spacewise, but we made do to keep our morning fruit and milk, cheese and yogurt cold as well as some beverages. The bathroom was roomy and shower great. As noted by a prior reviewer, there is only a curtain separating the bathroom from the rest of the living area. The bed and pillows were comfortable and we slept very well.

Our hostess, Effrat was friendly and helpful. While bringing up clean towels, she noticed we had rigged up a small clothes line between two patio chairs and she then brought up a clothesline frame and clothespins for us.

The only negative about our whole stay occurred before our vacation started, when Efrat inexplicably refused to extend the monthly rate daily discount we were paying for our stay to a one day extension of our original chosen dates--although we made this request several weeks before arriving. She did eventually reduce that extra day cost down from the non discounted normal daily rate, but still charged us $20 more than any other day of our stay. That oddity did give a bit of a bad taste entering into our stay, but the rooftop patio and the location quickly overcame this feeling. If we get back to Jerusalem, we would definitely stay again!

This apartment is in a tremendous location and has free parking (although you don't need it because you can walk everywhere).  It is quiet and has a spacious roof deck where you can relax comfortably.  If you are the type who wishes to spend a lot of time in the apartment, perhaps you should think again, as this apartment is extremely small - smaller than the photos make it appear - and the bathroom door is only a curtain.  But if you want a place with a warm, responsive host in a perfect location with a comfortable bed for sleeping, this is highly recommended.  We had a delightful time.

I wish I could give more than 5 stars! So much better than the pictures! I stayed here with my husband and we loved Efrat’s place and would definitely stay here again. Awesome neighborhood, easy walking to all parts of Jerusalem, a quiet/clean/stylish space, amazing rooftop views all to yourself and a free parking spot :) Efrat was helpful with local tips and great to talk to. Such a wonderful experience, thank you!

Efrats’s roof terrace studio was perfect for what we needed during our time In Jerusalem. It was fresh, clean, charming and we felt so lucky to be able to experience the beautiful view of Jerusalem every day. Efrat was so hospitable helping us with things like checking in early, giving us an idea of where to go in the city and booking our taxi to the airport. This is an amazing place to be based during a trip to see the sights on Jerusalem - cannot recommend enough!

We had an amazing stay. We very much appreciated all the tips Efrat gave us when we arrived as well as the very thoughtful honeymoon treats she left for us.  The apartment has everything needed for a very comfortable stay and we greatly enjoyed having private access of the rooftop.  The location truly could not be beat. We highly recommend this apartment and would stay here again without hesistation.
Perfect studio in the heart of Jerusalem; you can walk to all the major attractions. Efrat is a great host; she recommended a nice restaurant and bakery nearby. Highly recommended.

Spectacular rooftop views, space, location, and hosts made for a spectacular visit. The unit was nicely appointed with everything I needed for a 7-day stay. The location was perfect - close to Old City, the Shuk, groceries, restaurants, etc. The hosts were incredibly responsive, friendly, and helpful. There is a good reason they are superhosts. This is a can't miss place in Jerusalem. You will not be sorry.

The location is fantastic--you can easily access the Old City, the market, downtown, etc. Efrat is very welcoming and helpful--she gave us a lot of excellent tips for exploring the city. The private outdoor space is a really nice place to have tea in the morning before heading out. Highly recommend!
Quaint place with a nice roof deck
The place is special because of its excellent location. It would be better if the bathroom had a door. The sole use of the  private terrace was special.

Everything was just as described. All in working order and well-thought out.
Very private. Micki and Efrat were very helpful. Thanks!

Efrat was an excellent host. Check-in was flexible. The apartment is in a great location and comes with a parking spot (big selling point for us).

Would definitely consider renting this apartment again.

Highly recommended. Upper floor only apartment with no across the wall neighbors. Large patio-terraza. The neighborhood is so pleasant to walk, silent secure kind of sofisticated. The owner Efrat is available since she lives in the same building. We haven't see her after check in since there were not reason to call her. She didn't check the apartment for check out, just " leave the keys under the rug". We will come back
The previous reviews are correct--this is a wonderful apartment w views and to us so much better tj than hotel. We thought the bed was great and it is a real bed (many older reviews said no)
Awesome place--a cozy, comfortable studio bedroom + kitchenette; ample, updated bathroom, and fantastic private outdoor space. Efrat is gracious, kind, and responsive. I would return in a heartbeat.

A wonderful spot for walking to the sites of Jerusalem from your Air b n B. Parking was never an issue. Tell your cab driver to drop you off on Rahaman St. because no one knows Ibn Gavriol St. 15. Thank you.

Efrat is a wonderful host. Easy communication, lovely space, easily location for walking to Yehuda Narket, Old City, Israel Museum, Rose Garden.. . This is our second time staying here, we would return again.

Great apt and even better hosts. They stayed up to greet us at 1 in the morning. Apt was just as described and the view from the rooftop was stunning. Close to Jaffa gate and we would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Efrat and Miki are amazing. They are just awesome people! Helpful and cooperative.
This neat roof apartment is fantastically located and very private.
This is the place to go!

Good location. Very central to both the Old City and the City Center. Lovely rooftop space for meals and enjoying mornings and evenings. Efrat was very friendly and helpful, and she offered awesome suggestions for places to eat and to visit. We would stay here again.

Efrat and Mickey were amazing hosts - warm, welcoming and always available to help.

Their apartment is also fantastic. The location is perfect. The apartment is located in the beautiful neighborhood of Rechavia - residential and quiet, but also just a few minutes walk to everywhere you would want to go (Mamilla, Old City, Emek Refaim, downtown, etc.). I also really enjoyed the private rooftop. It's the perfect place to have your morning coffee or to just take a break and enjoy being in Jerusalem.

I hope to be back soon and can highly recommend it.

Efrat made us feel welcome instantly and the apartment was perfect -- exactly what we had hoped for. The weather was beautiful and we spent as much time as we could on the amazing roof deck. It was the perfect size for a couple looking for a quiet weekend -- and Efrat was extremely accommodating to all of our needs while we there. The location itself is perfect, walking distance to everywhere you would want to be in Jerusalem. Thanks for a great weekend!

Had a great time, absolutely loved the private rooftop it was awesome in the evening with the cool breeze. Efrat was a great host making sure I am completely comfortable and aware off all the surrounding shops, the parking spot was a great help.
On future trips I will definitely look to stay with Efrat again.
Our short stay with Efrat was great! She was so accommodating with our late arrival and so thoughtful in messaging us throughout or stay to make sure we were ok.

Wow, where do I start? If you are planing a grip to Jerusalem, absolutely stay with Efrat! The rooftop apt is charming, cozy and has everything you need. The view of the city is amazing on all sides! We we there on some unusually hot days and only used the AC one evening as the wonderful breeze keeps it cool. The neighborhood is great, with many shops and cafes (try Tommies for lunch) within easy walking distance. You are an easy walk to the Old City (a must see) and so centrally located to many other sites. Efrat spent a good half hour with us on arrival pointing out areas on the map, giving suggestions on travel to and from, etc. She also arranged our taxi for departure and kept in contact throughout or stay. Again having used many AirBnB sites this is one of the best we have found.
This is a great place! Fabulous view in a perfect location. The roof top patio is lovely.  Efrat was helpful and our stay was perfect.

We recently stayed 2nights at Efrat’s apartment in Jerusalem. The location is good, easy access to several areas in Jerusalem if you like to walk (12 to 15 minutes to the Old City, the Shuk, or German Colony). Efrat was very nice, very helpful with directions, and held our luggage for us after check out which was helpful and called a taxi for us which helped a lot as we don't speak Hebrew.
The apartment itself is small – smaller than most hotel rooms, but is newly remodeled (or possibly constructed) on the rooftop of the building, with some nice views of the city. Grocery right across the street. The covered patio is a nice touch. Very private and generally quiet for a city apartment. The bed is a futon couch so the mattress was small and not very comfortable. Otherwise it suited our needs.

Communication was fantastic and Efrat is a reliable, friendly host. The big roof terrace is a lovely place to spend Jerusalem nights. The actual studio is quite small and you have to walk outside to change your mind. Shower and bathroom impeccable, but only a curtain closes it off from main room.

Efrat and her Husband were fantastic hosts and the apt is a true gem. The private rooftop is truly spectacular, in an understated way. The apt is cozy and very comfortable and I really looked forward to coming home after walking around the city. The neighborhood is one of the nicest in all of Jerusalem. Rehavia is walking distance to the old city, yet quiet and filled with quaint cafes and tranquil streets. This will absolutely be my destination on future trips to Israel.
Thanks Efrat!

Efrat and Miki were exemplary hosts. They are a warm, affable and generous couple. Although I am familiar with Jerusalem and have family and friends living there, in the 3 weeks I lived with them Efrat and Miki checked in on me, invited me to their family Shabbat dinners, invited me to join them at the Dead Sea and more.

One evening Miki stopped by as I was sitting on the beautiful private rooftop deck. He noticed that I was listening to music on my iPhone. He decided that it would be a great idea to have Bluetooth speakers on the deck, and within a few days he had purchased and installed a system. He taught me how to work it, and for the rest of my trip the rooftop deck was felt like an intimate musical theater.

The rug by the kitchen sink became stained, and Efrat would not permit me to pay for the new rug. I need a can opener and within minutes Miki was at my door. The power was out on the afternoon I left, and the elevator wasn't functioning. Efrat and Miki's son carried my luggage down five flights of a dark staircase.

How lucky I was to stay in Efrat and Miki's rooftop suite. I only hope to be lucky enough to return again.

Our stay at Efrat's lovely rooftop studio apartment was wonderful! Great views of the city, and the rooftop brought nice breezes and cool nights. The apartment itself had everything we needed. And Efrat was always kind and helpful. Whenever we needed anything, she did her best to provide it. When we experienced a glitch in our Wifi, Efrat and her husband did everything possible (including bringing in a technician from the provider) to get it working. We were comfortable and happy throughout our stay, and we hope to be able to stay at Efrat's apartment again on future visits to Jerusalem!

Efrat's Roof Suite was the best imaginable place to start my trip to Israel.  The views were amazing. Very private and romantic place.  The  room was just right, and Efrat was extremely helpful with anything we needed and any questions we had; including directions and suggestions for anyplace we were thinking of going.  The location was great and really was within walking distance to many of the great spots you want to visit.  Will definitely return here next time.

Efrat and Mickey were gracious hosts, eager to make us comfortable. The rooftop suite is in a great central location in a very nice neighborhood. It is a very private and quiet accommodation. The room itself is not large, but the spacious outside rooftop area makes up for it.  The suite was totally clean and the bathroom is nice with a great shower! This is our introduction to Airbnb and we would definitely come back!

We had a lovely time at the rooftop suite! The deck area is huge and we had more than enough space for our needs. Efrat and her husband were very helpful and we really enjoyed our stay! Definitely would come back again :)

Wonderful!  Not only is the view spectacular, but the apartment itself is modern, well-stocked, and clean, and situation in a great location.  Efrat was response both before and during my stay, offered some local advice about places to visit and neighborhoods to walk in, while also completely respecting my privacy.  I couldn't recommend a place more highly than this one.
reviews.response: With pleasure, Jordan, and thank you for leaving the place so clean and tidy! Will love to see you again in Jerusalem.

reviews.comments:
Warm welcome, very clean and everything new. Great views and quiet except when wind blows as the tarpaulin side covers to decking flap.
Close to the centre of town without being in the busy area. The bed is very comfortable.
Great location, close enough to the center of the new city and to the old city. Cozy apartment in a modern building.

Efrat and her family were warm and accommodating throughout my stay in Jerusalem. I didn't feel well for a couple of days, and Efrat gave me throat drops and fever-reducing meds when I didn't have it in me to go to the pharmacy. The apartment is a little gem in Rechavia--very private and sun-filled. If you like jerusalem views, you will love seeing the glittering city from this eagle's perch at sunrise, sunset, and every hour in between.
Rooftop Suite was the perfect spot for us. Great location, and Efrat was an added plus. Amazing host, helpful and accommodating. Fully recommend this place and hope to return.
We loved this place. Great location, great host. Perfect size. We hope to return!
Clean with wonderful rooftop views. A much better value than any hotel. Efrat is sweet and accommodating and a pleasure to work with.

We stayed in Jerusalem for two days at Efrat's place. We had a wonderful time and Efrat was very helpful when we checked in. She gave us an overview of the area and recommended places for us to visit and eat. The apartment is cozy, clean and perfect for 2 people. The bed was very comfortable and we would stay again. Thank you Efrat :)

What a wonderful place to stay! Efrat and her family were incredibly welcoming - providing the quintessential AirBnB experience.

Due to inclement weather I made my travel arrangements at the last moment, and Efrat was incredible. Not only did she assist me with finding food for the weekend (as I was arriving just after the beginning of Shabbat), she was kind enough to provide maps, an umbrella and wonderful meal with her family.

I would stay again in a moment.

My girlfriend and I had a wonderful time at Efrat's place!

Before we arrived, Efrat was extremely quick to respond to our questions regarding arrival, parking, etc. When we did arrive, she was warm and welcoming, giving us a helpful tour of the unit and an overview of Jerusalem sights.

The location is extremely central and in a great neighborhood. A useful little supermarket is literally across the street. The unit itself is cozy, clean and comfortable, and the private rooftop area is just as cute as the photos indicate! While the bed is a sofa bed, it has a very nice extra layer on top of it. Neat little amenities are everywhere: candles, water cooler/heater, wine opener, colored lighting in the bathroom, etc.

At the end of our stay, many people in Jerusalem were talking about the roads closing due to a large snowstorm. Efrat and her husband invited us into their own apartment and were exceedingly helpful when it came to advising us about when and how to best leave the city.

I highly recommend Efrat and her place.

Super tiny, super cozy, super homey spot in the heart of Jerusalem. We really enjoyed having Efrat's loft as our homebase for our 3 days in Jerusalem. The location is very central and convenient to walk to many of the city's top attractions, and also close to public transportation to easily get to the more remote ones. The bed is not very big but it is comfy with soft, fluffy bedding. The bathroom is a very generous size for the apartment, especially the shower - nice and roomy! Everything in the apartment is simple, very clean, well-organized, and has all the basics you need for a nice stay. Efrat gave us a warm welcome and a thorough overview of the area, with several suggestions for things to do and see. Highly recommended.

Clean, private accommodations with rooftop terrace overlooking Jerusalem. Perfect location for walking everywhere in the city. Grocery across the street very convenient. Efrat and her husband live in the building and were helpful with maps, restaurant recommendations, etc.
The elevator takes you to the 4th floor but then you must walk up another flight. This was not a problem for us but might be for an older individual or couple. Also, the bathroom had a curtain separating it from the main room. For a couple, a door would have been appreciated; for an individual it wouldn't matter. Our first airbnb experience. We would repeat it and repeat it at Efrat's.
This is a small studio in a very quiet part of central Jerusalem, excellent location, walking distance to Old City and other main attractions. Efrat has been very helpful and caring host.

A lovely place to stay in Jerusalem. I traveled alone and felt safe both during the day and evening hours. Wonderful neighborhood with many places to dine and visit within walking distance. Easy access to the Old City and the light rail. My hosts were gracious and provided great hospitality. I am looking forward to returning soon! The location was absolutely perfect and the rooftop setting was definitely a bonus. I got to enjoy the full Harvest Moon rising over Jerusalem, indescribable beauty.
Thank you so much for your great hospitality!! We enjoyed staying at your place in Jerusalem. We will definitely stay there again. Shalom until we meet again.

Efrat was a great host. She welcomed us and gave information on the attractions in the city; she told us how to get to these places using public transportation. This neat apartment was within walking distance to the Old City in Jerusalem and the grocery is across the street. It is a very private roof top apartment with a great view of the city. My wife and I enjoyed our stay and would stay at this suite again.
Thanks Efrat for being a great host.

Ryan and Devica

Efrat and her husband were wonderful hosts. We had a very easy time communicating with them before and during our stay. They were helpful, hospitable, great with suggestions, and lovely to talk to. The rooftop room was wonderful, clean, perfect location. We will definitely be back!

We had a wonderful stay at Efrat's roof-top suite. The location is perfect, allowing us to walk to the Old City easily. Efrat was warm and welcoming, a delightful hostess. The apartment itself is small and cozy, but it had everything we needed for our 5-day stay. In addition to the apartment, we had the whole rooftop to ourselves, too. And…just outside the apartment, there is a small, shaded porch with a table and chair to sit for our meals (it's covered with bamboo, like a sukkah). A very nice place to sit and write…or think and relax after a day of sightseeing. Peaceful. Highly recommended for one person or a couple. The apartment is on the fifth floor/roof and the elevator only goes to the fourth floor, so the last flight of stairs must be climbed. The wireless worked very well.

Efrat could not be nicer and more helpful and her apartment is pristine and highly functional. The bathroom is newly refurbished with a great shower head and plenty of hot water. The bed is extremely comfortable despite being a fold-out bed. The wifi was fast and reliable. And the location could not be better. It is possible to walk everywhere from the apartment, which is truly in the center of town. A great place to stay when visiting Jerusalem.

This location can't be beat! It is easy to walk to museums, the Old City, the markets etc.

The suite was the perfect size for the two of us. And there is a grocery store directly across the street.

If we go back to Jerusalem, we would stay there again.

One thing to note is that the elevator in the building only goes to the fourth floor and it is necessary to walk up one flight. This is not a problem, unless you have a lot of heavy suitcases etc..

We enjoyed staying in Efrat's apartment in Jerusalem.  It was very centrally located and convenient for getting around without a car.  View is amazing from the roof.  Apt. was small but adequate for two people.

Great place with very good service! Great location and great for privacy. Would recommend for couples and singles. Efrat was amazing and was very sweet and easy to deal with. This is the place to rent!

Had a wonderful time staying in efrat's studio. It was bright and sunny, clean, and had everything you needed + more for a traveler. 10 min from old city, 15 min from German colony and the market.

i also appreciated that Efrat went out of her way to make sure I made the most of Jerusalem - from tourist tips (take her advice, she's a native) to pointers on getting around that saved me a lot of headache. Probably my best Airbnb experience so far.

Efrat & Miki are two very caring and honorable people as months of contact and two weeks of personal contact proved.

I rented their roof top unit which had the basics in addition to a large roof top view of Jerusalem and a deck with table in order to enjoy the open area of the roof with a deck and table to eat out.

Efrat took the time to assist in my efforts to learn the area/s, make appointments and understand the ways of the Israeli people.

Great People

Bob

Efrat's place is wonderful--perfectly located (major bus routes, lovely neighborhood to walk in, a small supermarket just across the street), impeccably clean, quiet, and with beautiful outdoor space and views. Efrat herself is the ideal host--flexible, very helpful, but not overly intrusive, and sensitive to the needs of her guests. I particularly appreciated her great communication leading up to my stay, her flexibility about my check-in time, and her help booking the sherut to the airport. I only wish I'd been able to stay longer!
We really enjoyed Efrat's rooftop apartments and it's great views!
The place was very clean and modern. Efrat is really niece and accommodating. Will definitely stay there again.

Perfect location in the Rehavia quite neighborhood. Short walking distance to the center of town and to the Matzleva valley for thous who wish to jog. Very private with the entire roof of the building to oneself so one can sit back and rest. The elevator is very important for thous with heavy luggage. I will definitely come again.

Efrat's rooftop apartment is even more beautiful than the photos show. It is modern, luxurious, and spotless - perfect for one or two people. And the view is astonishing! I could have just sat on the roof looking out over the city all day. The location is also ideal - only a 5 minute walk to the Old City. I will definitely try to stay here the next time I visit Jerusalem.

Efrat herself is an amazing host. She welcomed us in, gave us maps, and told us the best things to see and do in the short time we had in Jerusalem. She was always available by text message or email, and was kind enough to reserve a car for us to get to the airport on our day of departure. Highly recommended!

The apartment was in a great location and the hosts were so accommodating. I definitely recommend staying here. The old city, German colony, and market are all within walking distance. The place is small but clean and comfortable. My only complaint is that the pull out bed was not very comfortable, but we made do!

This is a well located apartment in the center of Jerusalem. It has everything that we needed to enjoy our stay. A walking distance to the old city and Ben Yehuda Street. Efrat was great and was very helpful. For sure we would love to spent time with Efrat again.
Marina
Very quaint and private accommodations in the heart of Jerusalem. Efrat was very sweet to us, gave us a lot of recommendations and sent us on our way. Thank you!!!!
Nice little studio/room with an excellent location right in the center of Jerusalem

Efrat’s place is perfect for a jerusalem stay, it’s located in the best area of Jerusalem and Efrat is a great and communicative host.
Highly recommend.
Great place to stay.  Efrat and Miki are the nicest and most helpful people.  Amazing roof with great views.  Highly recommended!

I spent two months in the rooftop apartment and thoroughly enjoyed my time there.  Efrat and Miki deserve their super host rating.  They were very friendly, responsive and hospitable.  The apartment itself is small but comfortable and very cosy in what turned out to be a cold and wet winter.  The fact that the occupant has sole use of the rooftop of the apartment block means that its very private and secure.  When the sun is shining and the weather is mild to warm, it's very pleasant sitting outside and admiring the excellent views and lively sounds of Rehavia.  The location is excellent.  The Old City, Downtown and the wonderful Mahane Yehuda market are all within a 20 minute walk and there are abundant public transport options close by, as well, which make it easy and relatively cheap to get anywhere in the city.  The wifi was fast and reliable and all the facilities in the apartment worked well.  Whenever there was a maintenance problem, Miki was very prompt in fixing it.  I have no hesitation in giving the apartment a high recommendation.

Very well located in a great local area, walking distance to the sights such as the Old City & the tram as well as a short walk to an excellent local cafe & wine bar. The space is most suitable for a couple. Whilst the inside space is essentially a bed sit the outdoor private terrace  increases the space available considerably & provides a lovely view  across the city roof tops. There is lift access to the 4th floor & then a walk up to the 5th floor. The apartment was very clean & we appreciated the little extras. The host met us as planned & explained to us about the local area & how to best get to the local sights & to make sure we included the Festival of Lights which was on in the week we stayed, which was great. Highly recommended. Thanks

Very nice small apartment in the city center.
10 minutes by walk for old city and new city center.
Perfect for two people. During the spring/summer you can use also a outdoor area.
Effrat was very helpful with everything. The bed was not so confortable and we add limited hot water but apart from that everything was very good. The terrace is very nice.
Nice host and nice place. A little smaller than expected. Everything else was perfect
Perfect place to relax and retreat during a intense and exciting visit of Jerusalem. Had a great time!
Excellent location!
My wife and I had a lovely time in Jerusalem - thank you Efrat! The check in was simple, location great, and we loved the roof terrace.

Very nice apartment, clean, cosy and comfortable. Great localisation- 15min walking to the old city. Host gives helpfull tip where to go, what to see and where eat local food.
The shop and bus stop are next to the building ( direct bus to Central Bus Station) . Also very fast Internet, enought to watch movie.
Everything was great !

Efrat’s place was perfect in every way! It had a nice rooftop view for our morning breakfasts and the place had everything we needed. The location was perfect with a 15 min walk to the Old City and a supermarket just at the corner. Our taxi driver told us this was a rich area and the neighbourhood is safe and calming. Would recommend for a couple who wants to enjoy Jerusalem, the Old City and a 9 min walk to the market. Also parking is a big plus in such a busy city!
Wonderful flat as well as brilliant hospitality and local tips from Miki and Efrat - highly recommended!

Great spot at excellent location. Efrat is helpful and available, yet discrete. For us perfect.
We’ll be back.
Friendly host great place to stay close to everything

Great rooftoop for a couple.
Great location!
Efrat received us personally at 9:30hs pm.
We loved!

Efrat’s place is within walking distance of the Old City (about 15minutes to Mamilla Mall and 20 Minutes to Jaffa Gate). We found the covered parking to be especially handy during our stay. There is a small supermarket just across the street and also a larger one about 5 minutes walk away. As mentioned by other guests it would be nice to have a door dividing the bedroom from the bathroom. The bedroom is a little small if you have a lot of luggage, but there is a large private outdoor area on the roof. Efrat was a friendly host and was quick to reply to my messages.

Efrat's place is practically perfect in every way. Location is ideal for contact with Old Town, downtown, and "First Station." There was covered parking and an elevator to the fourth floor (one flight up to roof). Contact was prompt and she lives two floors down for any concerns. Efrat welcomed us very late and invited us to her apartment the next morning to show us a map, help us plan our itinerary, offer us light breakfast and explain some local culture (we stayed during Pesach). The space itself is amazing - modern, and the rooftop offers incredible 360° views. The only caution I would give is that the bathroom doesn't have a proper door, but a curtain, so if you stay with a partner, you'll need to be or will become very comfortable together! Or enjoy the view on the terrace ;) But, absolutely we would come again. We loved it.

Unique and cozy place to stay! We were there during a cold snap so couldn’t take advantage of the amazing rooftop with the views, but it was a lovely little flat. Efrat was a fantastic host - loads of restaurant and other recommendations, gave us a map and got us sorted - she even gave us a ride to our bus stop when we left! Other than that, she gave us plenty of space - nice to know that we could always message her if we needed anything.

Flat was very clean and a comfy bed with good pillows. Great shower and roomy bathroom. Only thing to note is the bathroom has a curtain separating it instead of a door. Not a problem overall, but worth noting if you’re going as an, ahem, newer couple.

Location is perfect to access everything. You really can walk wherever you need to go. Quiet and central.
Location is simply amazing
Efrat is great!
Fantastic location within walking distance to the city' Jewish and Christian quarters. Cosy spot and lovely hosts!
This apartment is not as shown in the photos, it is actually so small there is not room to open two suitcases on the floor. It is well located and clean but really cramped for two people

I had a wonderful time at Efrat's small room with the HUGE rooftop!  The space inside was well organized, and pretty.  It was the outside space that really made my stay special.  Being able to watch the sun rise and set from the roof was so beautiful.  The location is perfect, about a 15 minute leisurely walk to the Old City.  Efrat was a great host.  She offered suggestions and called the Sharut taxi service to get me back to the airport.  I highly recommend her place!

We loved our stay at Efrat's apartment. It encompasses the entire rooftop of her apartment building and is quiet and private. It has incredible 360 degree views of Jerusalem and was extremely spacious. The apartment was clean and had everything we needed. Efrat was extremely easy to communicate with, and flexible for check in and check out times. She took time to get us oriented in the city and provided us with maps and recommendations which we used. We had a rental car and parked it in a safe spot that was provided below the building as promised. We had no issues finding a spot or leaving with the car when we needed it. There was a great grocery store across the street and the location of the apartment was fantastic - a ten minute walk from the old city and also very close to the city center and frost station. Would absolutely recommend this apartment.

I should start with the bad and make it clear that this colored my judgement. The parking space she has listed is not a parking space. It is parking storage. Each time I came out to leave, there were 3-5 other cars parked illegally blocking the exit. It took anywhere from 15 to 45 minutes to get the drivers to come move their cars. I missed an important meeting because of this one day. Her response to this was "I could have fixed this in five minutes" even though it took her fifteen minutes to respond to the text (which I sent in frustration after waiting fifteen minutes already).

The flat is ok as described, but you better be very comfortable with who you are travelling with. There is no door on the bathroom and the toilet is less than a meter from the bed.
reviews.response: Not always the complaint is in place and sometimes it is impatient and exaggerated, with all the respect... the building has six parking spaces and 8 tenants. Sometimes parking is full and a car or two blocks one another, but calling the neighbor and he comes quickly and kindly evacuating his vehicle. It takes 5 minutes. Parking in Rehavia neighborhood, so close to the center, is invaluable and priceless! This free parking is so much better than doing laps around the block looking for payed parking outside ... so we kindly ask our guests to be kind and patient, then can enjoy the bonus of the parking.

reviews.comments: Perfect place to stay in Jerusalem. Incredible roof terrace with great views and perfectly located. Would highly recommend!

This small appartement is just awesome: smart, cozy ans charming! Efrat is so nice and friendly, always helpful and attentive.
We would be more than happy to be back one day!

I had a lovely stay at this beautiful rooftop location in Jerusalem.  Efrat was a great hostess who met up with me and helped navigate my way around Jerusalem to see the best places it has to offer. The apartment was perfect for me - pleasant and spotless, and the location is great – walking distance to the Old City, The Market and Ben Yehuda Street, with a big supermarket nearby as well as numerous little ones.  I highly recommend this apartment for anyone who wants to experience Jerusalem up close and personal. Will stay again at this location for my next visit.  Thank you Efrat.

My husband and I had a very lovely time staying at Efrat's apartment on out honeymoon. She met us upon our arrival even though we came in late and gave us a map and showed us everywhere we wanted to go. The apartment was very clean and the rooftop balcony was beautiful! The location was also great, just a few minutes walk to downtown and the old city. Efrat even brought us some towels to use when we went to the Dead Sea. I would recommend this apartment to anyone visiting Jerusalem!

Best location in Jerusalem with best host!!! Efrat is the best host I ever met after staying with airbnb in more than 15 different cities! And the rooftop apartment is great! In 10 minutes walking distance to everything! Really want to go back again and stay there. (P.S. if anyone is reading the review, you should go to the market, Old city is awesome and amazing, but Jerusalem is more than that!

Everything was clean, the shower was very spacious the kitchen had everything needed, the balcony is very nice, gives additional room for eating, and all historic places of Jerusalem are within walking distance, the host Efrat was very kind and uncomplicated. There is a store to buy food just infront of the house, but attention: everything is inscribed in hebrew language, however, almost everybody understands english. The jewish quater of the old town was clean, save and with a special athmosphere and also the visiting of the western wall. We met very friendly people and it was very interesting to go on the underground tour along the wall.

It's a very nice roof suite in a perfect location. 15 minutes walk to the old town. Parking on the ground. It's not a big room but for 2 persons you have every comfort you need. Bathroom is very nice and all is clean. You can sit on the terrace and have an amazing view. Very friendly contact and welcome.

We had a perfect stay in Jerusalem. The flat is perfectly located, you don't need any car. Close to it there are several bars and a supermarket. The hosts were very helpful, in the apartment you find everything you need.

It has been a pleasure to stay in Efrat's roof suite during our stay in Jerusalem. It is ideally located to discover all the beauties and interesting places Jerusalem offers. Efrat is very friendly and does evrything she can to help when required. We keep a very good memory of our host and of the nice period of time passed to discover the old city, museums and part of the israelian society.
Absolut lovely place, perfectly located. Great hosts. We will come again!

The apartment is great: close to the old city, clean, right next to a supermarket and some restaurants and you have a beautiful view from the terrace! Also Efrat is a pefect host. She answered all our questions and had great advices.
We loved it!!!

Efrat was a very good host, she gave us many good tips on Jerusalem and was very helpful. One night, we couldn't find any empty parking lots in her apartment and she kindly offered us to take her lot. Location wise, key attractions are all within walking distance. Bed was comfy, roof terrace was amazing. Would love to stay there again!

Small but beautiful apartment in perfect location. Equipped with a comfortable double (sofa) bed, kitchenette and bathroom. Great views from the rooftop terrace, with a pleasant place to sit, watch and enjoy the city’s atmosphere. Very friendly, welcoming and helpful hosts. Will definitely come back.

We were very happy with the app and Efrat is really a helpful and great host! We could always contact her if we needed something. The app is actually as you see it on the pictures. The neighborhood is very calm and nice. The house is in the city centre but if you are walking its about 10-15min to the entrance to the old city. But we would definitely recommend it!

Great clean and light apartment in an excellent location close to key areas though quiet. The roof terrace is an additional plus and Efrat was very welcoming and helpful. We really enjoyed our stay and highly recommend it.
Lovely place! Location, atmosphere! Everything was perferct! Thank you!

We really enjoyed our stay. Efrat is very friendly and gave us lots of tips. The apartment is in a nice neighborhood within walking distance of the old town. The from the rooftop terrace was fantastic. For us (a couple) the apartment was ideal.

This was our first time in Jerusalem and we couldn't have chosen a better place to stay. Situated in the lovely Rihavya neighborhood, you're surrounded by happy local families and not too far from the German quarter (best restaurants, great wine shop there) and market. Efrat was a very discreet, generous host and gave us helpful recommendations for places to go.  The rooftop terrace is WONDERFUL, with a beautiful view. The apartment itself is spotless with every convenience you could need.  Don't forget to visit the Dead Sea, only a 30 minute drive away! I would definitely recommend this apartment to a solo or travelling couple. The one thing I would change would be to add a door to the bathroom. Thanks again Efrat for your hospitality, we had a wonderful time.

We stayed at Efrat place for 3 days, and really had a great time. Location is amazing, in a quiet neighborhood but just a few minutes away both from downtown and the old city. The suite is not huge, but has an amazing private terrace that we really enjoyed. As other people said, as the bathroom has no door I would recommend this to people who share a certain level of intimacy :) Super nice and helpful hosts!!

Great location and great set up. Lovely to be able to get away from the business to the privacy of your own rooftop. Really felt like a home away from home. It is quite small and there is only a curtain between the bathroom and the bedroom, so only go with someone you know really well and are happy having that level of intimacy with. Will definitely stay here again if we come back to jerusalem.

We had a warm welcome from Efrat and her husband at our arrival in Jerusalem. The roof suite was great; nice, cosy, clean and a great terrace!!! Everything we wanted to see was at walking distance (except the mahane yehuda market, but the lighttrain is just a few blocks away).
Efrat: thanks for our wonderful stay!
Dayenne en Theo
Very cosy and intimate little rooftop apartment! We loved it. It was very clean and Efrat gave us a lot of good tips of what to do in Jerusalem.
Excellent location, amazing view and basically everything you need for a wonderful stay in Jerusalem.

Efrat was a wonderful host in Jerusalem. The whole communication und organisation (check in and check out, tips for interesting sites to visit in Jerusalem, also for restaurants, cafés...) was very easy. We felt very comfortable on this Jerusalem roof top. The apartment is located very central, close to the old city. We would recommend it to everyone. Even if it's small (one room) the flat is nicely equipped and has everything you need for a stay of several days. You only should see, that there is no real door between bathroom/WC and the other room. So, if you need more privacy, this would be complicated!
Everything as described, we found everything we needed for a comfortable stay. The rooftop is stunning and Efrat was a very welcoming and helpful host. Thanks again for everything!
The flat is clean and like the pictures..but there isn't a door form kitcken and bathroom so.. we are in two and there is no comfortable..

We stayed at Efrat and Miki's apartment for a week as a part of our honeymoon. Wow, what an amazing time we had. We arrived in Jerusalem as snow started to fall and enjoyed the next week in a winter wonderland! Heavy snow, travel chaos, kids making snowmen - a one in a hundred year storm. The apartment was perfect, in a fab location and our hosts went above and beyond to make this a special experience for us. Amazing family, beautiful children and wonderful generosity. A memorial experience we will never forgot. The perfect place to stay in Jerusalem.

We  had a lovely stay  in Jerusalem,the apartement was very nice and very (Website hidden by Airbnb) was very close to the all Jerusalem and we could  walk to everywhere.The host was very helpful and proffesionel.We recommed it.

Amazing apartment, new, clean and well equipped, just in 10 minutes walk from Old City. Efrat and Miki are great hosts, Efrat answered immediatelly to all my mails, they were really helpful and suggested us many things to see and to do in Jerusalem. Unfortunately, we had no chance to enjoy the wondeful terrace because of the weather but we’ll be surely back.

Thank Efrat for your hospitality! The apartment has everything you need for travelers. A well-equipped kitchen and a hair dryer, iron, etc. The sofa is perfect and very comfortable, The shower is large and good. There is a wonderful view of the city. In the evening for example you can lovely and comfortably sit on the roof, as well as when you need, the whoul roof is yours. It is a very perfect location, near the Old city. Efrat is very kind and hospitable hostess and plesant.
Romantik small ap with a Great view And Top Location. Erfragt is a very(!) helpfull And Kind Host, i can Highlight cecommend this place!

Great apartment and great hosts! We've stayed at Efrat's place for a weekend trip to Israel. The place is in a very nice location, walking distance from the Old Town, and is very clean and cozy, plus, you have the rooftop all to yourself!  Efrat was a very helpful host, giving us lots of information about the city. Would definitely recommend!

We spent 2 nights at Efrats studio at the beginning of our trip to Israel. It was perfect, clean, big enough, with a big terrace outside,  perfectly situated, in the middle of everything you need to see in Jerusalem. Efrat lives in the same building, which makes the communication easy. She gave us precious informations about Jerusalem (it was just before shabbat so she gave us the good adresses to eat and to before). We strongly recommend it !

Efrat's little "penthouse" is on the roof of a residential building in a central and cozy residential neighbourhood, within a walking distance to the Old City and many other sights. The views from the roof are also spectacular. Efrat was very helpful and suggested a good itinerary to us.

Lovely appartment, just as described. Efrat is a great host who gave us lots of tips for our stay. The appartment is in an excellent location, just a few minutes' walk from the Old City and other interesting places and the rooftop location is wonderful. Amazing views, privacy and a welcome breeze after a long day of sightseeing. The private parking is an added bonus!

The stay at Efrat's apartment was simply great!
The location is excellent in order to visit Gerusalem, both the old city and the modern part; and the apartment was very clen and tidy, with a wonderful and private terrace up there: very romantic and gorgeous! Efrat was very nice even at comunication and providing us further information on what to visit and go in the night. Final comment: wonderful! I would higly recommend!

Our time at Efrat's apartment was perfect!!!
The apartment is spotless, and all the appliances worked great (notably the water cooler is so enjoyable after a day under the Jerusalem sun! And the air conditioning is very powerful!)
The rooftop is gorgeous and the view is amazing !! I can't think of a better place to relax after a day visiting the city!
Efrat is very kind and easy to communicate with, and took time to explain the different places to see in Jerusalem! She even booked a sherut taxi for us for our return to the airport!!!
I am very happy with our choice to stay at Efrat's place, and would definitely recommend it !!!

Efrat has a very nice place in an amazing city! Really beautiful view on Jerusalem from the rooftop. Perfect for couples. Efrat is very nice, gives good advice and does everything to make your life easier.

Efrat and Micky were great hosts and have always treated us like their friends :) we felt like being at home...
The apartment is well located for both the religious part of the city as well as the touristic part. So for instance, the western wall is 15 min walk while the market (Machane yehuda) is almost 10 min walk.
There are some restaurants and also an 24/6 supermarket down the street. The apartment and the view from the rough are amazing - we loved to sit after a long day outside and drinking nana or eating ice cream on the terrace and enjoying the sunset. You basically have all things you need, especially the elevator and the free parking space are probably most essential for a stay.

We would be happy to come back again and we only can highly recommend this place!

My cousin and best friend came tovisit mefrom Brasil. For our visit at Jerusalem we chose this cozy apartment, the idea of being in a roof was atractive! We were delight with the place and even more with the treatment of our hostess Efrat. Only i the day ofour coming I realiza that the room has only one big bed ( a sofa that was opened). I was very upset that I didn't read all the lines ( it was writing in the description) We were over 60 and it was a long time since we didd slepttogether. Efrat and her husband brought another single bed special for us! I really apreciate the efoort to make us confortable. the site is very central, have ac and a lift and for a couple is ideal!

Excellent location and very quaint and well appointed rooftop suite. They truly took care of us every step of the way and I highly recommend this suite to anyone looking for a place to stay in the very heart of Jerusalem.

The roof top appartment of Efrat and her husband Mickey is a wonderful place to stay in Jeruzalem especially because of its location. Rehavia is a green, pleasant and safe neighbourhood and after a busy day of sightseeing a very relaxed area to return to.

The apartment is within walking distance of almost every interesting place in Jeruzalem, such as the Old Town, Yehuda Market etc.

The apartment itself is clean, cosy, well equipped and with the big private roof terrace an amazing spot: you could never get this for the same price in a hotel for example.

So definitely worth to stay. Only disadvantage maybe the sleeping couch (we slept well on it, but some people might have very sensitive backs) and I was wondering about safety in case of a fire in the building. There doesn't seem to be escape stairs, but I didn't get the chance to ask Efrat, because my taxi arrived very quickly on my way home.

Thank you for a great stay
reviews.response: Thank you, Simone, for your lovely review. Regarding the emergency stairs -in Israel it is not common to build outdoor escape stairs and  internal stairs are enough to a standard fire (especially as it is only 5 floors building). As for the bed- it was arranged and replaced, for the benefit of future guests.  I'm glad you enjoyed your stay. We enjoyed hosting you!

reviews.comments:
The appartement was as described: very central, a very nice and super view, clean, hot water, wifi, very nice hosts who welcomed us in the middle of the night, we found some coke in the fridge and milk and coffe - excellent. nice bath.

this is a place for a couple because the bed is not too wide, you have to like each other.

we enjoied the stay totally, can fully recommend the place, it was brilliant to go there.

We had a great time in Efrat's (Website hidden by Airbnb) is small but new, clean, cozzy and really well located.The toproof makes it even better and cooler.Efrat was a very good host, she gave us indications about the city and the surroindings.Very recommendable.

Excellent! Amazing location.  Beautiful area within easy reach of everything you would want to see both new and old.  The space is well designed and carefully furnished. The roof terrace is very special. Efrat is friendly and very helpful - she runs it like a professional B&B.  A great experience and very good value.

Efrat's place is a nice studio on a private roof top patio with a beautiful view and walking distance to the best of Jerusalem (the market, old city, tram and bars). The place is exactly what you see in pictures with a GREAT LARGE stand up shower !!! As a host , Efrat's was very sweet, took her time at check in to give me helpful tips such as good places to visit and good spots to eat at. I definitely recommend this place to other airbnb users.
My stay at eifras was great! he apartment is very well located, very private, cozy and all the faciliies are great. Efrat was a great host very helpful and kind a++++++
Amazing rooftop apartment . Perfect place to stay if you visit Jerusalem. Efrat is very kind and helpful host.

A fine and central accommodation with a beautiful sight over Jerusalem.
We were able to park our car and Efrat is a perfect Airbnb-Host.

The place is very nice, spotless and welcoming. It is placed in the heart of (Website hidden by Airbnb) promised, although we arrived by car, we did not need it and walked everywhere by foot. Efrat and Miki were very helpful and nice. We enjoyed very much our stay and intend to return there in future.
Gabi and Ran Moses, Haifa

We really enjoyed our stay at this sunny and beautiful apartment. Everything there is great, exactly as it's described - the room is cozy, the kitchen is functional, the bathroom is clean and the rooftop is amazing. The Rehavia neighborhood is just perfect in terms of walking around and sightseeing: everything is close enough - the market, the Old City, museums, parks. Actually the apartment is placed in the middle of every place that the tourist in Jerusalem needs to visit. Efrat and Miki as a hosts were very warm and nice with us, they gave us some useful tips about the town and communication with them was easy and comfortable. We'd strongly recommend this place to anyone who'd like to visit Jerusalem and enjoy every moment of his accommodation.

All the things that I've found once in there were exactly such they have been described : no surprises ! I really appreciated that. Beyond than that, the host, Efrat, really cared whether everything was ok for me. this is so great having this kind of relation with the host when you go somewhere where you know nobody ! for these reasons, I do recommend you to go to this place.

Our stay at Efrat's was very nice.
The place is clean and comfortable. The roof gives an amazing view on Jerusalem.
The communication was very good. Efrat and his wife gave us very good tips, which helped us planning our stay.
I will definitety stay there again and I'll warmly recommend this place to my friends and family.

Roof Suite apt, was perfect for us. It was private, spotless and decorated with all the right touches to make it's guests feel welcomed and wanted. Meeting Efrat added to the pleasure of staying in her accomodations. A sweet suite in the heart of beautiful Jerusalem...

Superb accommodation and fantastic hosts!
They are just great! I would recommend this accommodation to my best friend!

We had a great time staying at Efrat's rooftop apartment!
It was very easy to communicate with Efrat and she made sure we were OK throughout our stay.
The apartment is very modern, clean and nicely decorated (very nice bathroom with a walk-in shower) The view is great and very relaxing after a day exploring Jerusalem.
You can't beat the location: halfway between the old town and the newer part of town in a very sought after area (Rehavia), you can walk to pretty everywhere.
Although it wasn't a problem to us, it's true that the apartment isn't very big but, as it says in the presentation, it's a studio.
Tip: write down the name of the address as some taxi drivers didn't know where it was (or, maybe it was my pronunciation!)

Very nice place in a great location: perfectly clean, new furniture, nice roof. Efrat and Miki are great hosts, very nice and very helpfull. Only shortcoming is the bed, which is a little short for very tall people. But still: five stars, highly recommended!

We stayed at this studio for 3 nights. It is perfectly located and we walked to all major sites in Jerusalem. It is a perfect pad with privacy and a great terrace outside. Even though it was slightly cold during our stay, the heater made it just comfortable. Most importantly, Efrat & Miki were exceedingly warm to us with their suggestions and Miki was actually kind enough to drop us off to the bus station early as we were trying to get out of Jerusalem before Obama's arrival.
I would definitely recommend this place and the lovely hosts to anyone and stay with them if I go back

It's a great place, the best location in the city, with a walking distance to all the highlights of Jerusalem. You have a privacy and a beautiful view, with sunset and moonrise! You can have It's clean and warm, even during cold winter days. Efrat and her husband were very helpful, giving advice and recommendations about the city, the neighberhood and trips outside Jerusalem. The wifi worked prefectly.
We were totally happy about the stay there, we can recommend it to everybody!
Great location, nice and cozy apartement that kept us warm despite the cold Jerusalem winter night outside and Efrat was very kind and nice to us.

Efrat's place is simply amazing. It is a small cosy studio flat on top of a building with private terrace. It was amazing to wake up in the morning, step outside on the terrace and see the sunrise. The suite is not very big but enough as holiday place. The location is perfect. walking distance from the old city and also from the city center with nice bars and restaurants.
Efrat is very nice, polite and helpful. She was always answering our (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) questions on (Hidden by Airbnb) . Really appreciated.
I strongly recommend this place.

Nice room in one of the best location of Jerusalem with all needed.
Everything was clean.
Our hosts were nice, easy to communicate and prepared many nice surprises for us. Highly recommended
Toda raba Efrat

This perfectly situated, cosy little roof apartment with a big terrace was exactly what we expected: clean, neat and well-supplied. Every morning we had breakfast on the terrace enjoying the fresh Jerusalem breeze and beautiful view. Efrat and Miki are very friendly and helpful, when we couldn't catch the wireless signal or had problems with the TV channels, they fixed the situation immediately. They also gave us maps and advice about how to get around, where to eat, etc. I highly recommend this place to any couple who want to spend romantic nights/days in the middle and above Jerusalem!

Efrat was the perfect host! She met us first thing in the morning to let us in and even helped us park our car.

The flat was simple, but exactly what we were after. It was very clean and a fantastic location for exploring the hustle and bustle of Jerusalem. The apartment itself is in a very peaceful location and has spectacular views over the city from its rooftop location.

The shower and the funky bathroom lights were were a particular highlight!

One thing to note was that we couldn't pick up the wifi signal on our phones in the apartment, but we could in the stairway. As it wasn't vital for us it wasn't much of an issue, however worth checking with Efrat if you are relying on it.

Would definitely return if ever in Jerusalem again.

What a wonderful place for spending weekend in Jerusalem.
quite place in the heart of Jerusalem.
Efrat and Miki was very helpful and very kind to us. We are highly recommend this place for anyone who want to spend few days in Jerusalem.

מיקום נהדר, גג מפנק ומארחים מקסימים.
אנחנו ממליצים בחום על הנכס של אפרת.

ממוקם בלב העיר, מרחק הליכה מאתרים מרכזיים, תחנות אוטובוס נוחות ומסעדות טעימות. יש חנייה פרטית שזה יתרון אדיר באזור הזה וחוסך המון כסף על חניונים.

הדירה עצמה הפתיעה אותנו מאוד לטובה. נעימה, נקייה ומאובזרת. השוס הגדול הוא הגג הענק והמאובזר לא פחות, שחלקו מקורה לשעות החמות/הקרות וחלקו פתוח עם נוף פנורמי.

אפרת והבת שלה היו מקסימות, זמינות לכל שאלה או בקשה ואפילו צ׳יפרו אותנו בדברים קטנים שעשו את כל ההבדל. נשמח לחזור.

תמורה הוגנת וראויה למחיר.
Studio très agreable et bien situé.

Rooftop très agréable quand arrive le soleil, on en profite grâce au mobilier de jardin confortable. Il y a même un BBQ à disposition.
L'appartement est petit mais la terrasse couverte agrandie l'espace de vie. Climatisation ou chauffage sont efficaces. Tous les accessoires de toilette et de cuisine sont présents. Sucre, thé, café, huile... étaient disponibles.
Efrat est une personne sympathique qui nous a gentiment aidée à organiser nos visites dans Jérusalem.

Un joli nid douillet avec une belle et grande terrasse au dernier étage !
L’appartement est idéalement situé au coeur de Rehavia, un joli quartier à moins de 15mn à pied de plusieurs sites majeurs :
La vieille ville et ses sites religieux historiques (Eglise Saint Sépulcre, Mur des Lamentations, Mosquée d’El Aqsa...), le centre ville, le Shouk (à ne pas confondre avec le fameux souk de la vieille ville lui aussi à voir)...

Certainement une des plus belles adresses de Jérusalem.

Et Efrat a été disponible et très enthousiaste pour nous renseigner sur les sites à visiter.

L’hébergement est propre et très bien placé, à 10 minutes de la vieille ville, du souk, de restaurants et d’autres curiosités. L’hébergement doit être très agréable par beau temps (on a eu de la pluie ;-( avec sa grande terrasse donnant sur les toits de la ville. Efrat et son mari ont été très réactifs dans la communication, accueillants et serviables allant jusqu’à nous déposer à une station de taxi pour retourner sur Tel Aviv. merci pour tout. Loic et Géraldine
Super appartement en roof top dans un quartier top de Jérusalem ! Notre hôte était très accueillante ! Je recommande fortement
Emplacement proche de beaucoup de sites essentiels (old city, market, street branchée)

Il s'agit d'un endroit magique avec une énorme terrasse magnifique et une vue sur surprenante sur toute la ville de Jerusalem! On y revient déjà la deuxième fois et on rêve d'y revenir encore. Félicitations à Efrat et à son mari pour ce petit endroit de rêve! Mille merci et à la prochaine!
Muy guay
Очень хорошо

De buurt van het appartement was prima, niet ver van de Oude Stad!
We hadden hoge verwachtingen van appartement en terras, maar dat viel tegen. Terras moesten we delen met de zonnecellen, er was geen scheiding aangebracht, en de terrasstoelen waren oud en gescheurd. Niet gezellig om te zitten.
Appartement was goedkoop uitgevoerd met een bedbank waar je niet lekker op slaapt, gordijntje voor de wc, kortom, we waren wat teleurgesteld na de verwachtingen.
reviews.response: I am pleased to note that the bed has been replaced by a new Divani bed with orthopedic mattress!

reviews.comments: Die Wohnung ist sehr zentral gelegen, die meisten Sehenswürdigkeiten sind zu Fuß schnell erreicht. Die Gastgeberin war sehr hilfreich mit Tipps bezüglich der Stadt.
Die Lage ist perfekt, die Gastgeber sind freundlich und hilfreich. Die Altstadt ist zu Fuss in ca. 10 - 15 Minuten erreichbar. Einkaufen kann man über der Strasse.

Estuve hospedada unos dias durante febrero junto a mi mama. Fue una linda experiencia el cointar con un espacio como el de Efrat, ya que nos daba privacidad, comodidad, disponiamos de una hermosa terraza con una vista maravillosa. La ubicacion es perfecta, esta cerca de todo.
Ampliamente recomendable sobre todo para una pareja.

L'appartement est petit, mais parfaitement à un couple en vacances. Pour peu qu'il fasse beau et assez chaud, le toit nous est effectivement réservé, ce qui offre une assez belle vue. L'accueil s'est avéré également très chaleureux, malgré la double conjonction d'une fête israëlienne majeure et de notre arrivée anticipée. De plus, la situation géographique de l'appartement, centrale entre la vieille ville à l'est, la nouvelle au nord et tous les bâtiments "civiques' (Knesset, musée de la shoah...) à l'ouest, est idéale.
Je recommande chaudement.

The flat is small, but perfect for a couple in short holidays. And if the weather is fine, the roof is reserved for us, with a nice view on the city.
We've been warmly welcomed, dispite an important day-off in Israel and our arrival early than expected. Moreover, the central geographic situation of the flat, between the new city, the old city, and the administrative city, is ideal.
I warmly recommand.
Estuvimos cómodos en el departamento de Efrat. Es acogedor. Efrat se mostró dispuesta a ayudarnos en lo que necesitaramos.

name: Nice apartment in Moshava
amenities: Dedicated workspace - A desk or table with a chair and space for a laptop.
Kitchen - Space where guests can cook their own meals
Long term stays allowed - Allow stay for 28 days or more
description: דירה במצב טוב, מרווחת, תקרות גבוהות עם מרפסת. הדירה מתאימה לזוג או למשפחה עד 8 נפשות. ניתן לאכול בחדר אוכל או על המרפסת.חניה בחינם ברחוב. קרוב לתחבורה ציבורית.במרחק הליכה (כ-15 דק') לעמק רפאים, מרכז המסעדות, ברים, עם חיי לילה.מיקום מרכזי. עם רכב כ-15 דק' מעיר העתיקה (או כ-35 דק' הליכה), כ-10 דק' מהכנסת, כ-10 דק' מבית ממוזיאון ישראל, כ-10 דק' ממוזיאון המדע, כ-10 דק' מגן סאקר, ....המקום שקט, עם הרבה ירק, שכנים מאוד טובים.הנכס מאובזר היטב. טלויזיה בכל חדר, מזגן בכל חדר, מכונת כביסה, כיריים ...
transit: ללכת ברגל בכל השכונה זה מאוד נעים

reviews.comments:
The house is well placed, furnished and well renovated. However, some basic stuff were missing in the apartment: Not enough linen and blankets for all the guests, toilet paper has been provided only after request (not to mention soap/shampoo), no soap for dishes, no Shabbos kettle or hot plate for shabbat (although this equipment is quite standard for jewish families who come for a weekend in Jerusalem).

In addition, this price is very high and the landlord was very impatient and did not try to satisfy the needs of the guests.

name: דירה מפנקת במרכז ירושלים
amenities: Essentials - Towels, bed sheets, soap, and toilet paper
Kitchen - Space where guests can cook their own meals
Cooking basics - Pots and pans, oil, salt and pepper

description: דירת 3 חדרים מרוהטת ומפנקת בשכונת קטמון המבוקשת בירושלים באיזור שקט במיוחד.חנייה בשפע מתחת לבנין, בקרבת גני משחקים ומגרשי ספורט.--מטבח כשר--מושלמת לשבתות וחגים.מרפסת לנוף ירושלמי, מרחק הליכה מעמק הצבאים.The spaceמטבח מרווח, כשר ומאובזר לשבת באופן מלא, פלטת שבת, מיחם וכו׳פינת אוכל מעוצבת עם שולחן גדול, סלון מרווח, מרפסת עם נוף מהמם.2 חדרי שינה, שירותים וחדר אמבטיה. דוד שמש, מזגן בכל חדר.Other things to noteמטבח כשר.קומה רביעית ללא מעלית.

reviews.comments: Avi was incredibly helpful and quick to respond. Everything was fantastic and we were so glad we found this apartment.

Tha sty was lovely, definitely recommend, the host was extremely nice, took care that we are well and acvomodated. The apartment was clean, organized, had all we needed and more and in a very quiet location, although mot far away from where we wanted to go
So great place, great host and great experience

תודה רבה על הכל. בית נפלא ומארחים מאד נחמדים. איחרנו והם חיכו לנו עד שהגענו. זמינות תמיד לכל דבר ובקשה. דירה נקיה, מסודרת ומרווחת. מכונת קפה נספרסו :-) וכל מה שצריך ל5 אנשים
תודה רבה
דירה קרובה, מיקום נוח ומארחים מעולים

description: לקחת פסק זמן מכל הרעש מסביב ולתת לעצמכם להנות ברגעים של אהבה יחד

name: A homely feeling in the heart of Jerusalem.
amenities: Essentials - Towels, bed sheets, soap, and toilet paper
Kitchen - Space where guests can cook their own meals
Cooking basics - Pots and pans, oil, salt and pepper
Dishes and silverware - Bowls, chopsticks, plates, cups, etc.

description: The apartment is not new or renovated, but well maintained and invested with lots of warm and homely atmosphereThe apartment consists of a bedroom with a double bed and a smart TV that can be connected from any Android to see in foreign languages + Netflix.Living room with sofa bed, TV and balconyKitchenette with seating area and table.toilet and showerI'll leave you clean sheets and towelsSoap, shampoo, and toothpaste that can be usedAnd also coffee, tea and milk is available for you :)The spaceHi there, I offer you my charming apartment, in a warm and homely atmosphere right in the center of Jerusalem.Two minutes walk from Mahane Yehuda Market, ten minutes from the city and a half hour walk from the Old City.The apartment is located in a very special neighborhood called Nachlaot.A neighborhood that was built at the end of the 19th century, and the streets are still narrow and provide a calm and quiet atmosphereGuest accessThe apartment consists of a bedroom with a double bed and a smart TV that can be connected from any Android to see in foreign languagesLiving room with sofa bed, TV and balconyKitchenette with seating area and tabletoilet and showerI'll leave you clean sheets and towelsSoap, shampoo, conditioner and toothpaste that can be usedAnd coffee, tea and milk is available for you :)Other things to noteQuiet and calm neighborhood, on Thursday nights there are noises from the bars in the area. Because of the narrow streets, a car can only reach the end of the street, and there is a minute walk.
interaction: Following plants on the 2 balconies in the summer, I will have to come in (by coordination of course) to water the plants.And I will be availabale during your stay for tips and any kind of help via cellphone. You can ask for anything and I will do the best I can to assist :)

reviews.comments: Reut is a wonderful host, keeping the place clean and cosy. The location is fabulous: an old residential area within few minutes' walk from the Mahane Yehuda market (beware: extremely busy on Fridays and the week before major holidays), and the public transportation along Agrippa and Yaffa streets. The apartment is comfortably compact, especially the kitchenette, but with nice rooms and spacious balcony. There is a pretty steep stair leading up to the door, which is not very easy to navigate, especially with the suitcases.

The location of the apartment is super convenient to access. Everything in the apartment are very good for me, more than I expected before staying. Especially, Reut is very nice and helpful person, I staying very appreciated. Praise LORD leads me to be there.

Our stay at Reuts place was great. We really liked the appartement and had everything we needed. I loved especially the bench in the window space near the entrance where you can sit and look outside, it was great for writing in the diary and postcards. Also Reut was such a lovely host. Though we couldn't meet in person, the check-in and described directions were perfect (we arrived at 04:00 in the night), Reut was reachable for questions and very helpful. If I come back to Jerusalem I definately want to book that place again. And this time meet Reut. ;-)

It's always rewarding to write a review about such a place as Reut's. Although she was quite busy at work while we were staying there, so we had a chance for a very short meeting, she made us really feel at home.

The place can be accessed via an astonishing little alley, which is one of the loveliest little streets is Jerusalem. The place inside is not fancy, but rather very stylish, welcoming and warm. You won't be staying in a sterile, standardized hotel room, but in a real home, with a charming little kitchen, and actually two balconies with great views, offering a chance to share a bottle of great local wine and have a chat about the day's adventures.

If I'll have the chance to revisit Jerusalem, I will be sure to stay at Reut's place again!
reviews.response: Thanks Szász, and always you will be gladly invited :)

amenities: Essentials - Towels, bed sheets, soap, and toilet paper

description: ~ Large room in a spacious, clean, comfortable apartment.~ Quiet apartment occupied by one female. No pets.~ One flight up, (18 stairs.)~ Near transportation, supermarkets, and shuls.~ Spacious common area.~ Available for Shabbat and kashrut respectful, female non smokers.The spaceThe bedroom is just over 12 sq. meters (130 sq. feet) in size.  It contains a single bed, and a second pull out bed.There is loads of closet hanging space plus shelves.  There is a utility porch which has a washer, but no dryer.The primary bathroom contains a shower, (no tub.)  There is a second small bathroom, right outside the bedroom,  with a small sink and toilet, exclusively for guest use.Guest access~The entire shared area and its contents are available to the guests.~The apartment is available to someone who is Shabbat respectful, ie. someone who will keep non Shabbat activities to the privacy of their room.The kitchen is kosher, with separate dishes and utensils for meat and dairy.  Separate kitchenware is provided for non kosher keeping guests.Other things to noteI’m happy to provide some **perks**  to make your trip more relaxing.•Arranging for a phone plan while on your trip can be a time consuming hassle.  I provide a free nano sim card, with unlimited local and US phone calls, plus data. • Summers in Jerusalem can be hot and humid.  Please help yourself to a cold water bottle each day of your trip.• Complementary coffee, tea, milk, and cold cereal available.
additional_house_rules:
~ Please treat the home and its belongings as you would your own.  
~Please keep shared areas clean and clutter free.
~ Female guests only.
~Children of all ages ok, under parent's supervision, and are considered an extra person in the room.
~No check ins or check outs before sundown on Saturday.
interaction: I am happy to accommodate whatever it is you might need, and to flow with a comfortable balance between friendly interaction and quiet privacy for all.
transit: ~ Street parking is available.~ There are a number of bus stops nearby.

description: This suite can accommodate up to 5-6 people. Its private balcony, facing the breathtaking vista of old Jerusalem - day & night, is one of the best points of view found in Yemin Moshe.The Dream has a private entrance, just 4 stairs from street level and contains:Master bedroom facing southeast- with a double bed (or 2 separate beds).Second bedroom facing southwest- with two separate beds. KitchenLiving room  + big terrace faced the view , free Internet  wi-Fi Minimum stay 3 nightsThe spaceAvissar Guest House in Jerusalem offers you 4 self-catering vacation suits in Yemin MosheAvissar House in Yemin Moshe is located in the exclusive neighborhood Yemin Moshe and faces the breathtaking view of the walls of the Old City of Jerusalem, the Valley of Hinom and numerous villages scattered on the hills surrounding Jerusalem.It is a ten to fifteen minute walk from Avissar House to the center of Jerusalem with its shops, restaurants galleries and nightlife. It is a ten to fifteen minute walk from Avissar House to the colorful markets of the Old City and its spiritual centers sacred to Jews, Christians and Moslems. These include The Wailing Wall, Holy Sepulcher, The Dome of the Rock, as well as many other religious and archeological sites.Guest accessall the suits are privet suits

reviews.comments: LOCATION WAS AMAZING, PRIVATE ROOFTOP MIRPESET OVERLOOKING THE oLD cITY WALLS WAS PERFECT FOR MEALS,
Amazing location just outside the Old City in a beautiful and quiet neighbourhood.  It’s a basic, slightly small apartment with great hosts that help with everything at all times of day and night.

A compact 2 bedroom apartment with a wonderful view of the old city from the rooftop terrace. Host was responsive and the location is excellent, being easy walking distance  to old city, israel museum, cafes and a supermarket.
